Mahmud is requesting a youth loan in the sum of $2,400 USD.  He will use this loan to buy a new motor generator and to install an external ceiling for his grocery store. In the future, Mahmud is aiming to improve his current financial conditions by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motor generator and to install an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en: Kadzo is a twenty-six year old mother of five children and a dry-land farmer. Her husband is also a farmer, and their agricultural endeavors face the challenges of low rainfall and lack of capital to invest in quality inputs. All five of Kadzo's children are currently in school and she intends to use the profits from her tree farm to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
EUFRASIA, who is in her late 40s is married and has four children, three boys and one girl.  She has been frying and selling fish for three years now.  She works from 7:00 am to 12.00 noon daily (works for 5 hours) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be EUFRASIA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more fish and cooking oil and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to complete building her house and pay school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more fish. She dreams of owning a big Restaurant.

EUFRASIA will share this loan with her loan group "RANGE" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Esilda

texts.es: Esilda de 38 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 3,8 y 9 años. En su propia vivienda tiene un congelador donde almacena productos alimenticios congelados, especialmente derivados de la harina de trigo. Así mismo vende mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos a través de los cuales ofrece mercancías variadas, como cosméticos, perfumería, bisutería etc. Su negocio nació desde hace 7 años, cuando observando a una promotora quiso seguir su ejemplo y así lo hizo sin aun haberse detenido, pues con ello ayuda a su esposo en el sustento del hogar y genera mas bienestar para todos. En su negocio vende de contado y a crédito y sus principales proveedores son las multinacionales y como productora también prepara deditos, empanadas y otros productos derivados de la harina de trigo, que prepara y vende especialmente para cuando se realicen los diferentes eventos y festividades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprara cosméticos bisutería y harina de trigo por bulto para aumentar su producción y responder a su clientela que cada día crece y hace que su negocio también se expanda.
texts.en:
Esilda, 38, is a married woman mother of three children who are 3, 8 and 9 years old.  She has a freezer at home where she stores frozen food items, especially those derived from wheat flour.  She also sells merchandise via catalog.  She sells a variety of goods like cosmetics, perfume, costume jewelry, etc.  Her business was born seven years ago when she observed a sales promoter and she decided to follow her example.  She did so and hasn’t stopped since because she helps her husband support their home this way and generates more well-being for all of them.

She sells for cash and on credit and her main suppliers are multinationals.   As a producer, she makes ‘deditos’ [ladyfingers], turnovers and other things made from wheat flour.  She makes them and sells them especially during various events and festivities.  

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry and wheat flour in bulk to increase production and meet customer demand that’s growing more each day causing her business to expand as well.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry and wheat flour in bulk.

loans.name: Dorys Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dorys, tiene una tienda la cual  les ayuda para sobrevivir. Los productos que venden son  de consumo básico, bebidas, gas, etc. Ella vive con su madre y su hija, tambien tiene familiares en el extranjero, pero no le ayudan mucho. El negocio inicio hace 3 años, lo cual ella lo administra con su hija, la ventaja que tienen es la buena clientela y sobre todo estabilidad. El préstamo lo invertirá en compra de suministros para la tienda como gas propano, arroz, frijoles, comidas enlatadas y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes muchos más productos.
La inversión le ayudara en gran medida a tener un mejor inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes, hará más rentable la tienda porque los beneficiados se sentirán más atraídos con nuevos productos. Su sueño es hacer de esta un minisúper asi como poder ayudarle a su hija en la educación.
texts.en:
Dorys runs a store so she can earn money to buy daily necessities. She sells everyday products such as drinks, gas etc. She lives with her mother and daughter; she has other family members living overseas but they don’t help her much. 

Dorys opened her business three years ago and she runs it with help from her daughter. Her great advantage is that she has a good customer base and stability above all. She plans to use the loan money to add stock to her store such as propane, rice, beans, and canned goods so she will have many more products to offer her customers.

The investment will help her a great deal as she will have a wider choice of items which, in turn, will lead to a more profitable store. Her customers will be attracted to the new products. Dorys’s dream is turn the store into a mini-supermarket so that she’ll be able to help her daughter with educational expenses.

loans.use: buy propane, rice, beans, and canned goods

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda, de 49 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, está casada  con Lucio con quien tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 21 años de edad respectivamente .Ella vive junto a su familia en una casa de material noble , la cual fue construida con el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación .La actividad que realiza Gilda es la venta de comidas, razón por la cual tiene un pequeño en local en su hogar, en donde puso las mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes, quienes se sienten satisfechos de la buena atención que reciben. También realiza la costura de ropas interiores por las tardes .Se inició  hace más de 6 años en el negocio de las comidas y a su vez cuenta con una mesera ya que necesita ayuda para atender a los clientes. En un futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus ambientes y variar sus platillos, además de poner una tienda de verduras en el frontis de su casa.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/. 1500 nuevos soles comprara ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás, buscando menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilda, 49, is a hard working and enterprising women. She is married to Lucio with whom she has three children aged 26, 23, and 21 respectively. She lives together with her family in a quality-built home which was constructed as a result of their effort and dedication. Gilda's activity is food sales; it's the reason why she has a small place in her home where she placed the tables and chairs necessary to comfortably attend to her customers who are satisfied with the good service that they receive. She also sews underwear in the evenings. She began working in the food business 6 years ago and at the same time she has a server since she needs help attending to the customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, improve her surroundings, and vary her dishes, as well as opening a produce shop in the front of her home.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to rely on a line of credit to be able to advance her business; that's why she is committed to fulfill her installment payments punctually. With the requested amount of S/.1500 [Peruvian Nuevo Sol], she will buy ingredients for food preparation such as rice, oils, vegetable stews, and other things, searching for low prices to obtain greater profit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1958. She has two children who are adults and they have their own family. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 5,000,000 VND. Hien grows rice and raises chickens, ducks and pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food to feed her poultry and pigs. She also wants to use the money to buy poultry’ seeds to raise. 

 Huong is 41 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

 Le is 45 years old. She has three children, She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy food to feed the poultry and pigs

loans.name: Eddys  Antonio

texts.es:
Eddys, un joven con deseo de superación,  de 23 años de edad,  originario de Granada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos  plásticos, del que es propietario hace más de 4 años. Desde muy joven inicio a trabajar en el comercio  pues su padre le enseño a ganarse la vida desde niño, fue creciendo  y aprendiendo a ser un hombre independiente y generar recursos por si solo, luego su papa decidió viajar a Costa Rica a vender otros productos con el objetivo de obtener otros ingresos extras, Eddys se siente muy satisfecho porque ha logrado incrementar sus ventas poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo,  y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias, sus productos los comercializa  en otros Departamentos como Diriomo.
Sus expectativas es poder ampliar su negocio. El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  panas plásticas, baldes, vasos plásticos y al mismo tiempo quiere comprar calzado como zapatos, chinelas,  sandalias, etc.  Con el objetivo de diversificar un poco más su negocio, y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, dentro de sus planes futuros es hacer crecer su negocio con productos que aun no tiene en inventario.
texts.en:
Eddys, 23, is a young man who wants to improve himself.  He's from Granada and a merchant by trade.  He makes a living selling plastic items; he has owned the business for more than four years.

He started to work in commerce at a very young age because his father taught him to earn a living.  He grew up and learned to be an independent man and generate resources on his own.  His father decided to go to Costa Rica to sell other products so he could earn extra income.

Eddys is satisfied because he has managed to increase his sales little by little with a lot of effort, earning more profit.  He sells his products in other departments, such as Diriomo.  He hopes to expand his business.

He needs the loan to buy plastic bowls, buckets, and cups.  He also wants to buy footwear such as shoes, slippers, sandals, etc.

One of his plans for the future is to make his business grow with products he doesn't yet stock so he can diversify a little and be able to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy footwear and plastic bowls, buckets, and cups

loans.name: Henry Oswaldo

texts.es:
HENRY  tiene 35 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

HENRY es Chofer Profesional. Solicita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace en el hogar. La compra la realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y tener una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra cualquier problema que se presente. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en: HENRY OSWALDO, who is 35 and married with one daughter, works as a professional driver.  He, his wife and their daughter live in Chimbo in Bolívar Province.  He is applying for a loan to buy a refrigerator which he greatly needs in his home and will go to the city of Guaranda to buy it.  His ambition is to improve his family's lifestyle and to own his own home.  He has to deal with any problem which life throws at him.  In his free time, he likes playing and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia es una sencilla comerciante, 41 años de edad, habitante de Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad respectivamente. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de 20 años, trabajando con su esposo en  el taller de carpintería, elaborando muebles para salir a vender a otros Departamento, ya que ellos se vieron en la obligación de trabajar los dos en el taller porque necesitaban el dinero para sobrevivir junto con su familia, ya que uno de sus  hijo es descapacitado. Con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo han podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera este negocios , ella cuenta con otros ingresos como es el dinero que le pagan por el cuido de un anciano, es así que Silvia lucha cada día por generar ingresos extras.
Silvia esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  maderas, sener, lija, pega, pintura, barniz, etc.  Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus muebles, con el objetivo de cumplir con los encargos que le hacen sus clientes  y mantener más sólido su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia, 41, is a simple tradeswoman. She is originally from Granada and is married with two children, ages 14 and 17. 

She started her business at the age of 20, working with her husband in a carpentry workshop. They made furniture to sell in other provinces. They felt the obligation for both of them to work, since they needed money to survive along with their family because one of their children is disabled. 

With plenty of effort and arduous work, they have managed to succeed with the earnings that this business generates. Silvia has another source of income, which is the money that she is paid to care for an elderly person. She fights every day to earn an extra income. 

Silvia needs this loan to buy wood, paint thinner, sandpaper, glue, paint, varnish, etc. She believes that this loan will help her to buy all of the raw materials that she needs to make furniture, with the goal of fulfilling the orders from her clients and maintaining a more solid business.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint thinner, sandpaper, glue, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en: Samson is a seventy-one year old father of seven and a widower. He is a dryland farmer but lacks the capital for fertilizers and his crops suffer from drought. Samson intends to use his profits from his KOMAZA tree farm to develop his agriculture by buying more land and better inputs.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 58 años, es una mujer alegre y muy responsable, esta casada con José con quien tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia casa junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Mary consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, así como la restauración de prendas de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, cuando necesitan que les hagan una ropa nueva no dudan en ir a casa de ella para pedirle que les haga la costura deseada, es muy buena haciendo su trabajo, lleva en el negocio mas 20 años, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y siempre tiene pedidos, trabaja sola pero cuando tiene grandes pedidos contrata a otras personas a quienes paga por sus servicios eventuales. Decidió poner su negocio porque  quería dar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y el dinero que ganaba su pareja no alcanzaba para los gastos básicos del hogar. Espera en el futuro poder comprar mas maquinas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Este será el préstamo numero 04 con Kiva, esta muy contenta de poder acceder a los prestamos ya que le son de mucha ayuda para poder tener mayor capital de trabajo.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará más materiales para la costura, entre ellas; telas, algodón, hilos y mas materiales necesarios.
texts.en:
Mary, 58, is a friendly and very responsible woman. She is married to José, with whom she has two children who are already independent. She lives comfortably in her own house with her husband. 

Mary's work consists of cutting and making items of clothing, as well as repairing clothing for her friends, neighbors, and relatives. When they need someone to make them new clothing, they don't hesitate to go to her house to ask her to carry out the sewing that they require. 

She is very good at her work and she has had this business for 20 years. Therefore, she has many clients and she always has orders. She works alone, but when she has large orders she hires other people who she pays for their services. She decided to open her business because she wanted to give a good quality of life to her children, and the money her husband earns did not cover their basic home expenses. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy more machines and offer her clients a better service. This will be her fourth loan with Kiva. She is very happy to have access to these loans, because they are of great help to her in increasing her working capital. With the requested amount of 2000 Peruvian soles, she will buy more sewing materials, such as fabric, cotton, thread, and other necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric and needles, among others.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is an industrious mother and wife. She is 48 years old and has been three years operating her buy and sell business. Within these years of selling fish, she has taken care of her children's needs such as allowances. To achieve greater income, she is requesting for a loan amount PHP 5,000 to buy more fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: To help her parents earn a living, 18-year-old Esmeralda has operated a dried fish selling business. She earns a maximum of 200 PHP each day from the business, which is a great help in their everyday living. She wants to earn more for the improvement of their poor living conditions. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital to purchase dried fish.  She hopes to further grow her business and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es una mujer con 36 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante madre soltera con 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella y ambos estudian. El mayor de 18 años esta en segundo nivel de secundaria y el menor de 14 años cursa el segundo de ciclo común al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayudan a su madre con las actividades del campo como ser: limpiar, abonar, fumigar y cortar la cosecha. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación debido a que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarle con sus estudios. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace mas de 15 años. La tierra que trabajan en familia fue heredada por sus padres hace un tiempo para cubrir gastos como la alimentación, vestimenta, estudio, medicinas, etc. La cual esta ubicada a 4.5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.  

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus sueños son de poder ver a sus 2 hijos graduados a un nivel universitario ya que de esa forma ellos podrán tener un mejor estilo de vida, un mejor futuro, una mejor educación y puedan heredar la tierra que hoy en día trabajan para que puedan seguir sacando provecho de ella y esta pueda pasar de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 36, is a fighting, enterprising woman with a desire to get overcome and succeed. She is a single mother with two children who depend on her financially, both of whom are studying. Her older child is 18 and is in the second level of secondary school, and her younger child is 14 and is in the second grade of middle school. After they get out of school, they help their mother with the farm labor, such as cleaning, spreading manure, fumigating, and cutting the crops. 

She does not have any educational degree, due to the fact that her parents had a low income and were unable to help her with her studies. From childhood she has made a living by cultivating coffee, which is what her family has done to this day. This is her only sustenance, as her parents taught her to work the land more than 15 years ago. She inherited the land on which her family works from her parents some time ago, in order to cover expenses such as food, clothing, studies, medicine, etc. The land is located 4.5 kilometers from her home, which they travel on foot every day.

She is currently asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure to maintain her coffee crops so that this harvest is healthy and profitable, in order to generate an income, obtain earnings and to be able to continue investing in the crops.

Her dreams are to see her two children graduate from university, because then they will be able to have a better lifestyle, a better future, a better education, and for them to be able to inherit the land on which they are working so they can continue making a profit from it and so that it can pass from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sergio Alexander

texts.es:
Sergio, se dedica al comercio de mercadería, cinchos, mochilas, llaveros ademas vende medicina natural, él vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, su casa es propia, su negocio lo tiene instalado en la vivienda y también tiene un puesto en el mercado, con esto ha logrado salir adelante con su familia.

Sergio, requiere de un  préstamo para seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su negocio especificamente en la venta de medicinas naturales, adquiriendo variedad para las necesidades de los clientes, este credito le ayudara para la compra de los medicamentos.
El quiere mejorar su negocio, los clientes también ayudarle a los hijos en sus estudios, mejoramiento en la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sergio makes a living by selling merchandise, such as belts, backpacks, and keychains, as well as natural medicines. He lives with his wife and their three children in their own house. He has set up his business in his home and he also has a stall in the market, which has allowed him to provide for his family.

Sergio needs a loan to continue working and investing in his business, specifically in the sale of natural medicines, by acquiring a variety of medicines that will meet the needs of his clients. This loan will help him to buy the medicines.

He would like to improve his business and his clientele. He would also like to help his children with their studies and improve the infrastructure of his home.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal is a 37-year-old widow, who lives with her mother, a sibling and 2 children in Ger in the Bayanhongor Province of Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays home. Her sibling herds livestock, and her children Adiyanyam, age 15, and Erdene-Ochir, age 12, go to local schools. 

The borrower has been working for various industries previously, and she is now starting her own taxi service business in town. She is requesting 850,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and get her existing car fixed in order to start her taxi service business in town. She is a hardworking, open-minded and modest woman, who has a dream of opening a small grocery store near her home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and get her existing car fixed in order to start her taxi service business in town

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka is 37 years old. She lives in a small village in the Tkibuli district, West Georgia with her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and 2 milk cows. Eka and her mother milk cows and produce cheese products to sell at local markets. Additionally, they have a vineyard and sell wine. Eka requested a loan for renovating a house. After the house is renovated they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a house

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer, 38, is married. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Azer has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best how to look after cattle. 

Azer usually buys small cattle then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 80 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. 

This is only one financial income in his family--not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Azer applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase three cattle, two milk cows and fodder. He has already had several loans with AqroInvest and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, two milk cows and fodder.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. Conchita has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. Conchita works hard to earn a living so that she can assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Conchita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Sheily

texts.es:
Sheily, de 45 años de edad, esta casada con German quien es docente y  padre de su hija de 17 años de edad.Ella vive en su casa propia en compañía de su familia y su suegra.La actividad que realiza Sheily es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de distintos sabores para eso cuenta con una congeladora grande que compró con el apoyo del padre de su esposo, y en donde guardan sus bebidas bien heladas al gusto de sus clientes. También vende golosinas de diversas presentaciones y marcas.Atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes ganándose sus preferencias .Tiene más de 04 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su hija.Tenía apuros económicos para pagar los gastos de su hogar por eso decidió poner un negocio nuevo y asi generar ingresos económicos esto le permite sentirse ocupada contando con un oficio. 
Por tanto tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer y en un futuro abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y esta agradecida con su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.  Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará bebidas gaseosas de diversa marcas y sabores, así como golosinas, ambos en mayor volumen para tener un stock surtido y disponible para la venta buscando asi satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sheily, 45, is married to German, who is a teacher and the father of her 17-year-old daughter. She lives in her own home with her family and her mother-in-law. 

Sheily makes a living selling soft drinks in a variety of flavors. She has a large freezer which she bought with the support of her husband's father, where she keeps her drinks very cold for her clients. She also sells various types and brands of snacks. By serving her clients in a very friendly manner, she earns their preference. She has worked in this business for four years, and she has had the support of her daughter to this day. 

She had some urgent financial issues in terms of their home expenses, so she decided to open a new business to generate an income. This allows her to feel busy because she has an occupation.

She plans to continue with her business and to make it grow so that in the future she can open a grocery store. This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for this collaboration in order to continue with her goals. With the requested amount of 2500 Peruvian soles, she will buy soft drinks in a variety of colors and brands and snacks, both in large quantities. Her business will then be well-stocked and ready for sales, with which she hopes to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.es: Jairo de 56 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde tiene un punto comercial donde vende herramientas, cerrajería, cambio o de guardas y desde allí también  vende pollo y vísceras. Su experiencia comercial data de hace 33 años cuando fue retirado por una empresa y decidió invertir su liquidación en un negocio  afín a lo que anteriormente conocía.  Hoy está muy organizado y tiene una capacidad de generar ingresos de manera independiente, por eso también se enfocó en los alimentos especialmente el pollo y las vísceras. En su cerrajería realiza instalaciones  y aperturas de puerta, elaboración de llaves candados llaveros etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y sus compras las realiza d e la misma manera Los principales clientes son sus vecinos transeúntes y referidos que se acercan para acceder a sus productos o a sus servicios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara maquinaria, cerraduras y herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jairo is 56 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla. He has a shop there, where he sells tools, locks, does locksmith work and changes locks. From there he also sells chickens and giblets. His sales experience dates from 33 years ago when he was laid off by a company and decided to invest his severance in a business similar to what he knew before. 

Today he is very organized and has the ability to generate income independently. That is why he also concentrates on food, especially chicken and giblets. In his locksmith shop he does installations and lock-opening, makes keys, and sells locks and key-rings, etc. From 8:00 am in the morning to 10:00 pm in the evening he sells for cash, and makes his purchases in the same way.

His main customers are his neighbors, passersby, and referrals, who come to see him to purchase his products or services. Now he is applying for a credikiva loan, his second from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy machinery, locks and work tools.

loans.use: to buy machinery, locks and work tools.

loans.name: Lidia Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia tiene 49 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 14 años, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace muchos años,  ella confecciona variedad de ropa, su taller se encuentra en su mismo puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de los Andes Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lidia va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión, La Sra. Lidia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, La Sra. Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lidia is 49 years old and has two children aged 8 and 14 years. She has been a dressmaker for several years. She makes various types of clothing. Her shop and her store are located in the same venue, in the Andes area. This is her first loan with the institution. Lidia will use this loan to purchase fabric in order to make garments by wholesale. The reason why she requests this loan is to increase the capital she has for investing. Lidia faces challenges in her business, such as improving her profits. She'll use her profits to buy supplies for making high quality clothing and therefore get more orders from customers. Lidia is a very hardworking person. She feels happy and thankful for the support provided by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to make garments.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 33 años, casada tiene tres hijos de las edades de 3, 5 y 11 años, ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista y también maquillaje y peinados en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de belleza para vender en su salón y algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  la Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Maria es tener su cadena de  salones de estética.
texts.en: Maria is 33 years old, married and has three children, ages 3, 5 and 11. She makes a living providing manicure, makeup and coloring services at her beauty salon located in the Pampahasi area in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan within this institution, and Maria plans to use it to purchase beauty products to sell in her salon as well as buying some needed supplies. In this way she can increase her working capital. She faces challenges with her business, such as market saturation, and is going to use her profits to keep buying supplies and improving her business. Maria's goal is to have a chain of beauty supplies.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, a 53-year-old married mother of one son, lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by working as a gardener, while she runs a business sewing clothing.

Hong, who started her enterprise eight years ago, is requesting a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more materials for making clothes. She hopes her expansion runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Daniela Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela  tiene 19 años, ella se dedica al servicio de copiado de todo tipo de llaves, su taller se encuentra en la zona del Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Daniela  va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de variedad de llaves base por mayor para realizar el copiado de llaves, y algunas herramientas  que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  La Sra. Daniela  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo.
texts.en: Daniela is 19 years old and makes a living copying all kinds of keys. Her workshop is located in the Tejar area of the city of La Paz. This is her first loan with this institution, and she plans to use it to purchase a variety of base keys at wholesale to make the copies, as well as buying some needed tools. In this way she will increase her working capital. Daniela faces challenges with her business, such as market saturation, and she plans to use the profits to keep purchasing materials and improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase base keys for copying.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Hai has been running a food stall in front of her house for seven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy good quality food to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby is a 21 year old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Baby has requested a loan to buy materials and equipment needed for making her plantation business successful. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Baby hopes to expand her business to earn a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives, and gloves,

loans.name: Airene

texts.en: Airene is 36 years old, married, and blessed with three children. To earn an income, she sells vegetables to the people in her village. She patiently does this activity in order to sustain their daily needs. She would like to improve her sales, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy eggplants, string beans, pechay, and cabbage to sell. This will increase her profits and enable her to save funds for the development of her family's living situation.

loans.use: To buy eggplants, string beans, pechay, and cabbage

loans.name: Hugo Patricio

texts.es:
HUGO tiene 31 años de edad es solytero no tiene hijos, vive en casa con los familiares en Chimo Provincia de Bolívar.

HUGO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cebada, trigo. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza, urea, semillas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesaruio para las siembras. Las compras de los productos agrícolas lo hara en Chimbo. 

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el timepo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
Hugo is 31 years old and single. He doesn't have any children. He lives with his family in a house in Chimo, province of Bolívar.

Hugo works in agriculture and grows corn, barley and wheat. He requests the loan in order to purchase insecticide, herbicide, weed killer, urea and seeds.

With the help of this loan he'll be able to buy what is needed for sowing. He'll buy the farming supplies in Chimbo.

His dream is to improve his living conditions. In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide, herbicide, weed killer, urea and seeds.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 42, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family by running a business of selling ovenware and porcelain products.

She started this business fifteen years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of ovenware and porcelain products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of ovenware and porcelain products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the additional items needed for her rice-selling business

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a 57-year-old woman from CPG, Bohol. She has been working in a fishing business for more than 10 years now. Cristita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat

loans.name: Poca's Group

texts.en: Poca is a thirty-three-year-old mother of nine children. She collects and sells firewood to earn money for her family, but it is difficult work to carry the wood long distances and she cannot afford alternative transportation. Poca says, "I joined KOMAZA because I want to develop like other people in the village." She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children and build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 48 years old years old and has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She wants to earn a better living. This causes her to strive more and continue earning through her business. She wants to add to the vegetables she currently offers. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy eggplant, bitter melon, pechay, and squash. She is looking forward to earning a higher income to save for her dream: to achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, bitter melon, pechay, and squash

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es: Juana de 45 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, aunque su esposo trabaja ella decidió no solamente dedicarse a ser ama de casa, por lo tanto en su casa tiene un parqueo de vehículos el cual tiene clientes que pagan por usar ese parqueo, este está ubicado en su casa de habitación la cual tiene el techo muy dañado, el piso entre otras, ella alega que con estos daños no puede dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y necesita hacerle unas mejores a su casa, ella es una mujer responsable que ama su trabajo y por lo tanto quiere lo mejor para sus clientes. Juana  ya ha trabajado con fundación lo cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, Los sueños de esta mujer es terminar y ver formados a sus hijos en profesionales, solicita este crédito para poder cambiar el techo de la vivienda, comprar (zinc, hierro,cemento, arena, cal,perlines, entre otros materiales).
texts.en: Juana is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. Although her husband works, she decided that she didn't only want to be a housewife, so she set up a parking lot at her home where customers pay to park their cars. This home has a badly damaged roof, and a bad floor as well, and Juana says that with these damages she is unable to provide a good service to her customers and needs to make improvements on the home. Juana is a responsible woman who loves her job and wants the best for her customers. She already has worked with this foundation and has demonstrated responsibility with making her payments on time. Her dream is for her children to become professionals. She is requesting the loan to replace her roof, buying zinc sheets, iron, cement, sand, lime, beams and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, iron and beams to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Isura Maria

texts.es: Isaura de 51 años de edad, soltera, madre de un hijo de 27 años de edad. Vive en el departamento de Chinandega lugar que está ubicado en el occidente del país. Es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante desde hace siete  años para salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su hogar,en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su hijo, y prepararle  comidas típicas de la región, como el gallo pinto. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económico, actualmente ella tiene una pareja  y le ayuda a distribuir en un triciclo donde reparte junto con doña Isaura los cosméticos a sus clientes, como una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable  también compro un mostrador para sus cosméticos y también venderlos en su casa a las personas que saben de su negocio y donde vive. solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza (cosméticos variados, shampoo, perfumes, cremas, lápiz de ojos, lápiz labial, crema hidratantes, rubor, mascarillas, colonias, artículos de limpieza facial entre otros) y así ampliar sus ventas. Isaura agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno ya que gracias a ellos ha podido ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: 51-year-old Isaura is single and has a 27-year-old son. She lives in the deparment of Chinandega, which is located in the western area of the country. She's a hardworking woman. She has been making traveling cosmetics sales for the past seven years in order to get ahead and support her household. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her son and cooking typical local dishes such as the "gallo pinto" (rice and beans) for him. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to go to college due to a lack of financial resources. She currently has a partner who helps her to get the cosmetics to the customers by using a tricycle which he shares with Isaura. As a hardworking, enterprising and responsible woman, she also bought a counter to display her products. That way she can also sell them from home to people who know of her business and where she lives. She requests this loan in order to purchase more beauty products (various cosmetics, shampoo, perfume, lotion, eyeliner, lip liner, moisturizer, blush, face mask, cologne, facial cleansing products, etc.) and therefore increase her sales. Isaura gives thanks for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a means of livelihood. Thanks to them she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies (perfume, cologne, facial cleansing lotions, blush, vanities, etc.).

loans.name: Laura Jimena

texts.es:
LAURA JIMENA tiene 23 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padres y con el hijo en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

LAURA JIMENA se dedica a la compra y venta de grano seco. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar grano gruezo de maíz y vender para semilla a los agricultores. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá compra el grano y vender aún buen precio, Las compras las realizará en Chimbo.
 El sueño es siempre contar con capital de trabajo suficiente.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia.
texts.en:
Laura Jimena is 23 years old and single, and she has a son. She lives with her parents and her son in Chimbo, province of Bolívar.

Laura Jimena buys and sells dry grains. She requests the loan in order to purchase coarse corn grains and sell them as seeds to farmers.

With the help of this loan she'll be able to buy the grains and sell them at good prices. She'll make her purchases in Chimbo.

The challenge she faces is the competition. She enjoys spending her free time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase coarse corn grains for selling to farmers as seeds.

loans.name: Anhaa

texts.en: Mr. Anhaa is 22 years old and lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Badamsuren, works at a local company as an assistant worker. He rented a car and ran a taxi service previously. He is now requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, energy-efficient car to provide his taxi service. He is a hardworking, helpful, and diligent man.

loans.use: To purchase an eco-friendly, energy-efficient car for his taxi service

loans.name: Syuki

texts.en:
Syuki has a retail business in the Eastland area of Nairobi. He has operated it for the last 15 years, and it has been profitable. He is 47 years old, married to Esther, and they have five children.

This will be his third loan, and he plans to use the amount to buy more items to sell in his business. These include rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil. He will use the generated income to pay for his children's school fees.

Syuki hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale business to make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en: Kakha is 33 years old. He is from a small village in the Khobi district. He lives with his wife, two children, brother and mother. Kakha is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a horse, a pig, a calf and two milk cows. His wife milks the cows and produces cheese products to sell at some local markets. Besides, he has a plot of land where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts locally at a good price. Kakha requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, he will be able to expand his business and produce more cheese products to sell. This will increase the income for the family. With an increased income, Kakha will provide better living conditions for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Furaha's Group

texts.en:
Furaha, meaning "happiness" in Swahili, is a forty-seven-year-old mother of seven children and a dryland farmer. She grows maize, cowpeas, and cassava, but pests destroy the crops and she cannot afford pesticides. 

Furaha is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because "KOMAZA is helping the poor by planting trees for income generation." With the profits from her tree farm, Furaha plans to buy land for her family, invest in a dairy cow, and send her children to high school. 

Someday, she would like to own her own business, have a permanent house, and send her children to university.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Al-Nour Group

texts.en:
Al-Nour is a group which consists of four women from Hodieda, Yemen. They asked for a 150,000 YER loan from AMB to help them improve their business.
Abeer is a 30-year-old single woman. She didn’t complete her education because she is responsible for her family. She has been selling clothes for her business. She started up her business two years ago. She goes door to door to sell some products especially in her neighborhood. She is making modest profits. She got a loan of 40,000 YER to expand her business. She wants to buy a new collection of products and start selling them to her clients not just in her neighborhood but also in nearby neighborhood. She looks forward to opening her own retail store when she earns large profits.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of products and start selling them to her clients

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 58 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living.  She has been with her business for over 10 years and earns 10,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011. Now she has requested a loan of 12,000PHP to purchase fishing materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha's businesses have picked up very well. She was also able to start an electronics shop besides the water vending business. The income from the previous loan helped to pay for her children's education. She also supports wedding functions like hiring generators out and selling neon lights for such functions. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of electrical and electronic goods for sale. 
Her ambition is to grow this new business to a wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase electrical and electronic goods to sell.

loans.name: Kandi

texts.en:
Kandi paid off her previous loan owing to a good harvest for the previous season. She has acquired another loan of 30,000 KES, which will facilitate her in diversifying her business into livestock-rearing. She will buy goats and sheep to fatten and sell later.

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate some of her children as well as put up a better and house for her enlarged family.

Her hope and dream is to see her family's living standards improve.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 73-year-old man from Vihiga County in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Jane and they were blessed with five children, and he supports his grandchildren.

Joel sells animals from within his region. He has been doing this business for the last 33 years and this is the main source of income for the family. He makes an average monthly income of KES. 5,000. He is taking his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase animals to sell. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his grandchildren. He has the hope of living a happy life at his old age

loans.use: to purchase cows to sell.

loans.name: Dimas

texts.en:
Dimas is a 37-year-old married man and a father of two children ages ten and six. He is engaged in the hog raising business and has been in the business for more than ten years now. Dimas is also a fisherman.
Dimas is asking for a loan worth 4000PHP to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. Dimas believes that this loan could help improve his business, thus increasing his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es casado tiene un hijo de dos años, vive en  casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y realiza gradillas (pequeñas escaleras) para hospitales, también realiza camas para terapia intensiva, todos los trabajos lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir materia prima es decir fierros, tornillos y otros.
El sueño de Julian es tener su taller y distribuir sus productos a nivel nacional.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julian is married, has a son who is two years old, and lives in his parents' house. The house is located in the Rio Seco (dry river) zone of the city of El Alto. He studied until high school, and he makes small staircases for hospitals. He also makes beds for intensive therapy. He does all of this work with the help of his wife. 

He needs the loan to acquire materials, like metal, screws, and others. Julian's dream is to have his own shop and distribute his products at the national level. This is the first time that he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy metal, screws, and other materials to make things like beds and small staircases for hospitals.

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya is a 26-year-old woman who is married with one son. She is an IDP and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Ulviyya has been breeding cattle for the last 4 years. She was a housewife, but her husband's salary was too low to cover the family's needs, so Ulviyya decided to start her own business. She receives 80 AZN in financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover the family's needs.

Ulviyya usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN, and this business is the main source of income for her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase five cows. This will be her fourth loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy five cows

loans.name: Sanita's Group

texts.en: Sanita is a 28-year-old businesswoman and the mother of four children. She sells fish and works at a retail kiosk to earn money for her family. Sanita's fish trading is inhibited by a lack of capital to buy large quantities, and the lack of a means of storage. Sanita says she likes "KOMAZA because it is planting fast-growing trees for income generation." She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to build a permanent house with electricity for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Waqas

texts.en: Mr. Waqas is 30 years old and a married man. He has been running a tire shop in Punjab, Pakistan. He purchases used tires at a low price and sells them at a high price after maintaining them. He is a very hard-working person and always tries his best to fulfill the needs of his family. He has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase tires to sell. He wants to open a new shop for his brother with his profits. He dreams of a bright future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase used tires to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 68-year-old man from Sagero  in Migori county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Jesca who also gives a hand in their family. He supports a family of five people including his grandchildren. He was blessed with two children who are now 27 and 22 years old.

Moses manufactures bricks for construction. He has been doing this business for the last 16 years and this is what has helped him educate his children, he makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. He has served several KADET LTD loans and he is taking his fifth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more water and firewood for making bricks. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of increasing the volume of his business and making sure that his family has a stable income throughout their lifetime.

loans.use: to purchase water and firewood for making bricks

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 38 years old and married with two children.

Elnora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elnora requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs. She also earns an additional income from food vending.

Elnora has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en: Badri lives in the village of Zeindari, Vani district. He is a widower and lives with his son, daughter in-law, and one-year-old grandchild. The total income of the family is 950 Lari per month, which comes from agriculture activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and owns a plot of land, where nut trees and greens are grown. Badri and his son harvest the grapes, nuts and greens to sell locally at the markets and get a monthly income. With the requested loan Badri plans to build a greenhouse, where different kinds of vegetables will be grown seasonally. He already has purchased wood materials, and with the requested amount he will buy polyethylene materials for covering the greenhouse. This will allow Badri to develop his agricultural business, which will be positively reflected in the family income and family living conditions.

loans.use: To buy polyethylene materials for covering the greenhouse and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Yasasif

texts.en:
Yasasif is a 37-year-old man who is married with two children. He is an IDP and lives with his family in a Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows, calves, and sheep. He sells milk, yoghurt, home-made cheese, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Yasasif has 5 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to best look after cattle.

Yasasif usually buys livestock, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and sells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to his neighbors. His milk and meat-selling brings in 110 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the only source of income in his family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Yasasif applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase 10 sheep, one calf, and one milk cow.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep, one calf, and one milk cow

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad is 25 years old and an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one daughter. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 5 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families, and are also used to make fresh punch.

Azad sells his crops in the Bilasuvar Settlement and sometimes in the bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise crops. 

As these products are in high demand, Azad wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for an 1800 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation.  Azad looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruits a lot.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is a married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. Eduarda has been working in a rice-farming business with her husband for more than 20 years now. 

Eduarda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm and to pay for her children's school fees. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and send her children to school for an education. In the future, Eduarda hopes to expand their farming business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est une femme camerounaise de 55 ans. Veuve, Micheline élève les poules près près de son domicile depuis plus de 07 ans. ayant actuellement une bande de 120 sujets , elle souhaite acheter davantage de nourriture pour nourrir les poulets afin qu'ils soient plus dodus et par conséquent plus rentables. les bénéfices obtenus lui permettrons d'augmenter la production et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Micheline is a 55-year-old Cameroonian woman.  She is a widow.  For more than seven years she has been raising hens near where she lives.  She currently has 120 birds.  She would like to buy more feed for her chickens, so that they become more "plump" and can therefore be resold at a more profitable price.  With her profits, Micheline will be able to increase her production and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 58 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business that sells rice cakes in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than 8 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase some ingredients for making rice cakes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase some ingredients to make rice cakes to sell

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Loh is 63 years old, a widow, and a mother of six grown-up children. Two of her children are married, and four of them are single. Her family relies on her four children who are all employed in various careers; one among them provides a transportation business in their area. Loh’s son would like to expand his services and make it more profitable. He wants to have a tuk-tuk to make his dream come true.

To assist her son and sustain his transportation business, Loh has applied for a Kiva loan to buy a tuk-tuk. This may result as a good profit for Loh’s family. She hopes that through this loan, her son will be able to go far in his business. This will be Loh’s first loan cycle with HKL as well as Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a tuk-tuk for her son

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 53 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Clarin, Misanmis Occidental. She owns and operates some farmland, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community to earn a living. 

Luz has been with her business for many years and earns 5,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 39 years old and supports six people. Hosea runs a small scale farming business. He has been in the business for the last two years. His monthly income from the business is KES. 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES. 15,000 for a period of six months, which he intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, maize seeds and beans seeds for this year's planting season.
 

He plans to use the additional income to invest back into the business and to purchase irrigation kits to set up an irrigation system in his farm. His dream and hope is to educate his children and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, maize seeds and beans seeds for this year's planting season.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is their main source of income.
Eleuteria is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing ventures and augment their earnings from it.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Carla Alejandra

texts.es: Carla tiene 24 años  y es Soltera , sigue con la actividad de  venta de  calzados de cholitas, cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en gastos personales, se compro una computadora ya que ella sigue estudiando, en  esta ocasión solicita el  préstamo para a la compra de un mueble de computadora y escritorio,  ya que necesita para una mejor comodidad para estudiar. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Para culminar de mejor manera sus estudios y llevar mejor control de sus ventas.  Sueña para su negocio es Tener una tienda grande de zapatos.
texts.en: Carla is 24 years old and single. She continues with her activity of selling traditional "Cholita" footwear. She says the last loan went well for her since she used it for personal use; she bought herself a computer because she is studying. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy a computer desk and writing desk since she needs them to study more comfortably. Her reason for requesting this loan is to finish her studies in the best way possible and to have better control over her sales. Her dreams for her business is to have a large shoe store.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Jackson Wamutu

texts.en:
Jackson, who owns a retail shop and a grocery business, used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. He bought rice, sugar and vegetables, and it was very profitable.

This being his fifth loan from KADET LTD, Jackson plans to use the amount to buy grocery items to sell. These include bags of potatoes, beans, fruits such as mangoes, oranges and pineapples, and tomatoes, as well as vegetables. This will enable him to increase his income which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

Jackson hopes to grow his business and supply grocery items to various markets.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruits, potatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zaal

texts.en: Zaal is 36 years old from the small village of Khobi district. He is married and lives with his wife and parents. His father is provided with a retirement pension. Zaal is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milk cow, two milk buffalos and two horses. His wife and mother milk the cow and buffalos and produce dairy products to sell at local markets. Besides, Zaal has a plot of agricultural land, where 300 nut trees and different kinds of citruses are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. In addition, he purchases fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then brings them with his own car to other villages to sell with a price markup. He requested a loan for purchasing a stock of fruits and vegetables. He will be able to increase the sales and thus increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Zaal awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy dressed chicken, meat, and spices for her food production business.

Vilma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Vilma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken, meat, and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Judith Diane

texts.fr: Judith. est une jeune Camerounaise de 30 ans. Célibataire et mère de 02 enfant dont le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé 06 mois, elle est spécialisée dans la vente de crédit de communication et confiseries depuis près de 05 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Judith souhaiterait acheter le crédit  en gros. les bénéfices accumulés lui permettront d'agrandir son activité et mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Judith is a young Cameroonian woman.  She is 30 years old, single, and the mother of two children.  Her oldest child is eight years old, her youngest is six months old.  

For almost five years now she has become specialized in the sale of telephone credit and confectionery.  She works in one of her city's neighborhoods.  In order to better meet the needs of her customers, she would like to buy telephone credit in bulk quantities.  

With the profits that she will accumulate, Judith will be able to increase her activity and to better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy phone credit and confectionery.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a carpenter living in the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and father of seven children.

Felix is asking for a loan to buy materials for his house renovation like wood, cement, nails and others. With this, he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy materials for his house renovation like wood, cement, nails and others

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda de 58 años es una mujer de amplia capacidad laboral, viuda y con solo un motivo de vida que es su hijo Maycol de 18 años.Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Inicialmente se dedicaba a la venta de comida en el mercado de abastos de su localidad logrando con ello iniciar la construcción de su vivienda.
Con el paso de los años logro habilitar el primer piso de su vivienda y posteriormente inagurar su tienda de abarrotes.Lleva 10 años con el negocio y con el paso de los años ha logrado consolidarlo y convertirlo en un buen sustento para su familia .Gracias a la venta de productos de primera necesidad así como el arroz, azúcar y demás cereales ha logrado desempeñar su negocio convirtiéndose en una persona conocida dentro de su zona, complementa su negocio con la venta de refrescos preparados a base de frutas de la región como el mango y naranja gracias a una maquina expendedora que adquirió hace poco.
Hace poco tuvo inconvenientes con su salud la cual la obligo a dejar por un pequeño periodo su negocio y actualmente requiere contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera para llenar nuevamente su negocio y trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza.Amanda tiene como obejtivo a largo plazo la construcción de un piso mas de su vivienda esperando así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.En esta oportunidad requiere contar  con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, conservas enlatadas y cereales.
texts.en:
Amanda 58, is a woman with a great capacity for work.  She's a widow and has only one reason for living, her son Maycol, 18.  She has a house made of quality materials where she shares her family experiences.

Initially she sold food in the wholesale market in her town, which enabled her to start building her house.  As time went by she managed to set up the first floor of her house and later she opened her grocery store.  She has had the business for 10 years, and she has managed to strengthen it and turn it into a good means of support for her family.

Thanks to the sale of necessity items such as rice, sugar, and other grains, she has managed to carry out her business and become a well-known person in her area.  Thanks to a vending machine that she acquired recently, she supplements her business with the sale of soft drinks made of regional fruit such as mangos and oranges.

Not long ago she had some health problems, which obliged her to give up her business for a short period of time.  Currently she needs the help of her financial institution to stock her store again and work with her characteristic motivation.

Amanda's long-term goal is to build another floor on her house, hoping to improve her family's quality of life.

Currently she needs 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, canned goods, and grains.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and canned fish

loans.name: Christine Elise

texts.fr: Christine Elise est une dame âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. tous ces enfants vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente de vivres frais dans un quartier de la ville depuis un an seulement. elle exporte les fruits vers l'europe et reçoit en retour des sacs, chaussures, parfums qu'elle commercialise sur place. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des fruits, plantains, bâtons de manioc, ananas en grande quantités pour augmenter ses capacités de vente. elle veut également acheter un congélateur pour la conservation de certaines marchandises
texts.en:
Christine Elise is 41 years old, married, and the mother of five children who all attend school.  She has been selling fresh produce in one of her city's neighborhoods for one year only.  She exports fruits to Europe, and in return, she receives handbags, shoes and perfumes which she sells locally.  

She would like to use her loan to buy fruits, plantains, "cassava sticks", and large quantities of pineapples, in order to increase her sales capacity.  She also wants to buy a freezer, in order to be able to preserve some of her produce.

loans.use: to buy fresh produce.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old, married with five children, and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like skirts, blouses, bags, etc. to sell.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of her ready-to-wear business for 15 years and also earns an additional income from food vending.

Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like skirts, blouses, bags, etc. for her ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 43 años de edad es un hombre casado que habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas,  en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno en el departamento de Bolívar. Allí se dedica a la construcción y adecuaciones de viviendas oficio que aprendió hace 20 años, y en el que trabajó para otros hasta que se independizó y formó su propia manera de generar ingresos, para aumentar el bienestar de su hogar. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja todos los días, adquiriendo los materiales en ferreterías y negocios especializados en obras constructivas donde adquiere buenos precios para ser más competitivo si copra en mayor volumen. Últimamente le han salido muchos contratos y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para comprar de manera exitosa, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, prime financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para construcción y con ello responderá a su más fiel clientela. Su meta es apoyar la educación de sus hijos para que estos en un futuro sean exitosos mediante una educación de calidad.
texts.en: Dagoberto is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in San Juan Nepomuceno, within the Bolivár department.  There he works in construction and has done so for 20 years.  He worked for other people at first and then went out on his own and formed his own way of earning an income in order to improve the quality of life in his home.  He sells for cash and works every day, buying his supplies in hardware stores and businesses that specialize in construction.  He gets good prices so that he can be more competative.  He buys in volume.  Lately he has been getting a lot of contracts but his working capital is not sufficient to be successful, so he has requested a loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy building materials and be able to respond to the needs of his most faithful customers.  His goal is to support his children's education so that they wil have a successful future through a quality education.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Jenny  vive en Guayaquil, tiene 31 años.
