Ella nos indica que empezó a trabajar pintando uñas haciendo limpieza de cutis a domicilio, luego una amiga la recomendó con mas personas lo cual le fue bien y con un pequeño capital comenzó a comprar sus cosas para poder abrir su salón de belleza.  

Ella realiza su trabajo de  desde las 10:00 de la mañana hasta las 20:00 de la tarde. No le dificulta nada hasta ahora y tampoco lo quisiera en un futuro No está casada, es soltera pero tiene 1 niña menor de edad que estudia en escuela fiscal. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar muebles para su salon de belleza. EL sueño que quiere realizar es poder  abrir una sucursal en otra parte de su salon de belleza y así darle mejor vida a su hija y con el tiempo tener un spa.
texts.en:
Jenny lives in Guayaquil, and she is 31 years old.  She tells us that she started working painting nails and doing facials from her house.  Later a friend recommended her to others, which went well, and so with a little capital she started buying things so that she could open up her own beauty salon.

She does this work from 10am until 8pm.  She hasn't had any difficulties so far, and she doesn't expect any in the future.  She is not married, but she has a young daughter who attends public school.

With this loan, Jenny wants to buy furniture for her beauty salon.  Her dream is to expand her beauty salon so that she can provide her daughter with a better life, and eventually have a spa.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her salon

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es:
Hector David tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Hector lleva 3 años en la agricultura, el produce café el cual es vendido en pergamino en el mercado local a intermediarios. Dice que la paga que recibe por el producto es muy rentable de los cuales ha podido tener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento diario.
En la actualidad solicito su tercer préstamo de 12,000 lempiras, para comprar abono, mantenimiento y limpieza de la finca. Este préstamo le ayudara a darle mejor asistencia a los cultivos y así obtener mejores cosechas y producción.
Su meta es cuidar y mantener el cultivo en buena calidad y la paga del producto siempre se mantenga rentable para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Hector David is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in an area surrounding Taulabe, Comayagua.  He has been a farmer for three years and raises coffee, which he sells in parchment to suppliers at the local market.  He says that the payment he gets from the product is very good and he has been able to earn the income he needs for daily support.

He is asking for a third loan in the amount of 12,000 lempiras so that he can buy compost and do maintenance and cleanup in his fields.  This loan will help him to provide better attention to his crops and have a better harvest.

His goal is to care for and maintain his crops so that the income will always be enough to support his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería lo cual le gusta mucho. El vive con su esposa en casa propia y no tienen hijos.
El este oficio lo aprendió cuando tenía 15 años, se lo enseño su abuelo y desde entonces el maneja las tierras heredadas. El préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de semilla, abonos, pagos de trabajo (rastreada).
La inversión que él requiere le ayudara a mejorar siempre su fuente de ingreso principal y mantener estable su familia.  También crecer más como persona y poder seguir luchando en la vida con lo que el tiene.
texts.en:
Juan works in agriculture and animal husbandry, and he enjoys this work a lot.  He lives with his wife in his own home; they have no children.

Juan learned this trade when he was 15 years old.  His grandfather taught him to farm, and ever since he has managed land that he inherited.  Juan will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for a tractor to till his land.  

This investment will help him to improve his farming activity, which is his main source of income, so that he can keep his family's finances stable. He will also grow as a person, and be able to continue to strive to do the best in life with what he has.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for a tractor to till his land

loans.name: Flaurence

texts.fr: Flaurence est une dame âgée d 39 ans. mère de 04 enfants, elle est spécialisée dans la vente des boissons hygiéniques depuis près de 05 ans. Le précédent crédit lui ayant permis d'augmenter son stock de marchandise, Flaurence souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter davantage son stock en achetant des casiers de boissons. les bénéfices engrangés lui permettront d'assurer davantage le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Flaurence is 39 years old and the mother of four children.  She is specialized in the sale of health drinks and has been involved in this activity for almost five years.

Flaurence's previous loan helped her to increase her stock of merchandise.  She is now taking another loan to buy crates of drinks, in order to further increase her stock.

With her profits, she will be able to better ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 35 años, está casado con Margarita con quien tiene dos hijos de 09 y 04 años, tiene una casa propia en el cual recién esta empezando a vivir con su familia.Carlos  tiene dos trabajos uno de ellos es  la venta de pescado y la otra el trasporte de personas en su mototaxi  .El se va al puerto todas la mañanas a comprar diferentes tipos de pescado para luego distribuirlos por las diferentes calles de la ciudad, lleva realizando este trabajo por 08 años y lo hace solo aunque cuando necesita personal contrata temporalmente a algunos trabajadores de la ciudad.Le gusta ambas labores, pues siempre trabajó ligado al comercio y le gusta mucho estar en constante movimiento y ambos trabajos le permite tener su libertad de tiempo y acciones, sus actividades le generan buenas ganancias y por el momento se siente tranquilo con lo que tiene y genera, pero más adelante le gustaría poder tener mejores ingresos poniendo un local dedicado a la venta exclusiva de pescado.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará diferentes tipos de pescadoy repuestos para su mototaxi ya que el sistema del mismo se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Carlos is 35 years old and married to Margarita.  They have two children, ages nine and four.  He has a home of his own where he and his family are just beginning to live.  Carlos works two jobs, one of which is selling fish.  The other is driving a moto-taxi.  He goes to the port every morning to buy differnet types of fish to later distribute around different streets in town.  He has been doing this for eight years on his own, but he hires temporary help around the city whenever he needs it.  He likes both jobs and has always been tied to business.  He likes to constantly be moving and both jobs allow him to have his freedom in time and action.  His activities provide a good income and at the moment he feels comfortable with what he has and earns, but he would like to have better income and set up a fish store.  This will be his first loan through Kiva and he promises to make his payments on time.  He will use the 800 PEN to buy different types of fish and spare parts for his moto-taxi becasue it is in need of repair.

loans.use: to buy fish and spare parts.

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.fr: Marie Solange est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 32 ans, fiancée et mère de 3 enfant dont l'âge varie entre 03 et 09 ans tous allant à l'école.comme activité elle dispose d'une échoppe dans laquelle elle vend des produits alimentaires et de la boisson depuis 01 an seulement. elle voudrait ce crédit pour acheter des produits alimentaires (biscuits, bonbons, chocolat, etc...) et de la boisson hygiénique pour renforcer son stock et pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. ce qui va augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et par conséquent ses revenus. ces derniers lui permettront d'assurer la scolarité, la santé et la nutrition de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Solange is a young woman from Cameroon.  She is 32 years old, engaged to be married, and the mother of three children aged 3 to 9, who all attend school.

Marie Solange runs a small kiosk where she has been selling food products and drinks for one year only.  She is taking this loan to buy food products (cookies, candy, chocolate etc.) as well as health drinks, in order to strengthen her stock of goods and to be able to meet her customers' demand.  This will also help her to increase her turnover, and as a result, her income.  

Marie Solange plans to use her income to take care of her children's educational, nutritional and health-related needs.

loans.use: to buy food products and drinks.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, с 2009 года Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав с 20,000 сом KGS. На сегодня в хозяйстве Анаркан имеется 6 дойных коров, 15 овец и 5 лошадей. Ежемесячная прибыль от перепродажи скота составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 голов лошадей. Доходы Анаркан планирует вложить в расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Anarkan is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children.  As a source of income for her family, Anarkan works with livestock and has since 2009.  She started her business with 20,000 KGS.  Today in her care, she has 6 milk cows, 15 sheep and 5 horses.  Her monthly income from the resale of livestock is 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Anarkan has turned to Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy three horses.  The income from the loan will go towards further business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase 3 horses for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hard-working gentleman aged 32 years.  He is married to Emily, a business lady, and is a father of three. He learned about KADET LTD from one of his regular clients who is already a registered member.

Charles run a motorcycle transport business for the last one and a half years, earning a monthy income of KES 25,000. He has been advanced a second loan of KES 60,000, which he will add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle and hire a staff so to assist him to serve a wider network of clientele. 

Charles plans to use the increased proceeds to expand his transport business. His hope and dream is to own a fleet of cabs.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to expand his business

loans.name: Kokoyian

texts.en:
Kokoiyian has paid off her KES 50,000 loan from the sale of her farm produce. She has acquired a fourth loan of a similar amount, which she will add to her proceeds to diversify her business to livestock rearing.

Kokoiyiana has managed to educate her children from the sale of different crops and is now diversifying into animal rearing. She hopes to used the increased proceeds to put up a better housing unit for her large family.  She hopes to raise a well-educated family.

loans.use: buy livestock to trade

loans.name: Shahzad Saleem

texts.en:
Shahzad Saleem is a 30-year-old hard-working person. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. Since 2011, he has been running a clothing shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He sells variety of ladies dresses in his shop. 

Shahzad Saleem has requested for a loan amount of 100,000 PKR  from BRAC Pakistan to purchase ladies dresses to sell. He wants to grow his business with the profit amount. He is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase dresses to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old, married and has 3 children.

Nancy is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.  She also earns an additional income form abaca weaving.  Nancy requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.  

Nancy has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.  She wants to save up for the future and improve her business.

loans.use: buy feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай 44 года, замужем воспитывает 2 детей школьного возраста.Канышай проживает в одном отдаленных сел южной части Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской местности, Канышай с мужем откармливают скот,занимается полеводством и садоводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 2,000 сом (KGS) после развала СССР. На сегодняшний день, Канышай содержит бычков в своем хозяйстве, продажа мясных продуктов позволяет зарабатывать для семьи около 9,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Канышай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов для перепродажи и на остаток средств планирует закупить удобрения и семена для весеннего посева. Доходы Канышай планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kanyshai is 44 years old, married and is raising 2 school-aged children.  She lives in a remote village in southern Kyrgyzstan.  Like many families in the area, Kanyshai and her husband farm, garden, and fatten livestock.  They started their business with only 2,000 KGS after the fall of the Soviet Union.  Kanyshai raises bulls, and the sale of meat products brings in around 9,000 KGS each month for the family.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy additional animals to resell.  What's left of the loan she plans to use to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant in the spring.  She plans on using the income from the loan to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 12 and 7. She and her husband are engaged in a motorcycle transport business. This the only source of their income. 

Grace is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle, like tires, nuts and bolts.  In the future, she hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Murtaza Ali

texts.en: Murtaza Ali is a very hard-working person. Since 2000 he has been selling artificial jewellery in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This shop is the only source of income for his family. Presently, he is interested in purchasing a variety of jewellery from the market to sell. For that he has requested for a loan amount of 120,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his net income and savings.

loans.use: buy jewellery to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 44 years old and married with four children, 3 of them are still in school.  She has a grocery business in Emali town. She has been in this business for the past 14 years and it has been profitable.

This will be Joyce's second loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of grocery items such as potatoes, mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions, carrots and watermelons.  She anticipates to generate more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Joyce hopes to open a bigger grocery store, make more income, and be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mercy's group. It consists of four women who live in Teshie. Together, they have requested a loan in the amount of GHS 2200.

One member of the group is Mercy.  She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She sells slippers and she has been operating her business for six years. She pushes herself to work hard in order to provide for her children's needs.  

Mercy has applied for a loan in the amount of GHS 700, which she will use to buy two big bags of slippers to offer for sale. This loan will improve her business income and help improve her family's living standards. She hopes eventually to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy slippers to resell

loans.name: Khurram Ishfaq

texts.en:
Khurram Ishfaq owns a small cosmetics store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a 34-year-old hard-working and honest man and a responsible father of 2 children. His children are students. 

Khurram Ishfaq is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing a variety of cosmetics to sell, including powder, perfumes, nail polish, etc. But, due to financial constraints, he finds this difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan for 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Jeonita

texts.en:
Jeonita is a 56-year-old married woman from CPG, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods to the people around her place.

Jeonita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and stocks for her store like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages.  In the future, Jeonita hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: buy fishing nets and restock her store

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 51 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Гулнара с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от перепродажи скота и полеводства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность обустроить детей.
texts.en: Gulnara is 51 years old, married and has 4 children.  Since 1990 she has farmed and worked with livestock.  She started her business with only 15,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, today in her care she has 2 cows with offspring, 10 sheep, and 2 horses.  Her monthly income from the resale of crops and livestock is around 5,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnara has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy sheep.  She plans on using the income from the loan to continue adding animals to her business which will allow her the opportunity to better provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sheep and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulmairamkhan

texts.ru: Гульмайрамхан 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гульмайрамхан начала бизнес в животноводстве со сбережений в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день развитое хозяйство, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Гульмайрамхан обрабатывает 1,38 га поливной земли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмайрамхан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и ГСМ для получения богатого урожая. В будущем, Гульмайрамхан хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Gulmairamkhan is 43 years old, married and has 3 children.  In 2000, while searching for a source of income for her family, she started a livestock business using her savings totaling 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, her business brings in around 7,000 KGS each month from the sale of milk and meat products.  Gulmairamkhan also farms 1.38 hectares of irrigated land.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy fertilizers and fuel in order to have a rich harvest.  In the future, Gulmairamkhan wants to expand her farm and her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and fuel for her tractor

loans.name: Nurbu

texts.ru: Нурбу 38 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Нурбу занимается животноводством. Стартовав с покупки одной коровы, Нурбу смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день две дойной коровы, два теленка, одну нетель и одну лошадь. Нурбу имеет около 7,000 KGS  ежемесячного дохода. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойное коровы для увеличения доходов от реализации молока. Доходы Нурбу планирует вложить в обучение детей.
texts.en: Nurbu is 38 years old, married and has 3 children.  She works with livestock in order to provide her family with a source of income.  She started her business by purchasing one cow, and has expanded from there.  Today, she has 2 milk cows, 2 calves, 1 heifer and 1 horse.  Nurbu's monthly income is around 7,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy 1 milk cow which will increase her income through milk sales.  She plans to put the income from the loan towards her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase 1 milk cow

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршеду 26 лет. У него жена и маленькая дочь. Он со своей семьей живет в городе Худжанде. Мать Хуршеда Мохру тоже живет вместе с ними. Она работает в текстиле портнихой. Отца Хуршеда нет в живых более 10 лет. 
В данное время Хуршед продолжает профессию отца. Он занимается производством ворот и решеток. Он занят в этой сфере уже 7 лет и приобрел большой опыт. Поэтому теперь Хуршед хочет расширить свое производство. С этим намерением он запрашивает кредит для производства ворот и решеток.
texts.en: Khurshed is 26 years old, married, and has a young daughter.  He lives with his family in the city of Khujand.  His mother, Mokhru, lives with Khurshed and his family.  She works as a textile seamstress while his father passed away more than 10 years ago.  Currently, Khurshed is continuing on in the profession of his father.  He has worked in the production of doors and latices for 7 years and has gained much experiences.  Now he would like to expand his production.  With this intent, he's asking for a loan to assist him.

loans.use: in the creation of doors and lattices.

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es:
Anahi es separada y tiene dos hijos, ninguno de ellos asiste al colegio, viven en casa de su hermana mayor, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella está en segundo año de Ingeniería Petrolera de la universidad; Anahi vende una gran variedad de productos alimenticios de la reconocida marca  “Gloria”, los días jueves y domingos en la feria 16 de julio.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir cereales y galletas al por mayor. Así aumentara su capital de trabajo y sus ingresos por las ventas.
El sueño de Anahi  es convertirse en un distribuidor a nivel nacional.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Anahi is separated and has two children, neither of whom are in school yet. She lives in her older sister's home located in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto. She is in her second year studying petroleum engineering at the university. Anahi sells a wide variety of food products by the renowned brand "Gloria" on Thursdays and Sundays at a flea market. She is requesting the loan to acquire cereals and cookies at wholesale, thus increasing her working capital and the profits from her sales. Anahi's dream is to become a distributor on a national level. This is her second loan with IMPRO and the first through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase Gloria-brand cereals and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Aisulu

texts.ru: Айсулу 29 лет. Айсулу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  с 2004 годы сразу после того как вышла замуж Айсулу занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 4 лошади, продажа молока приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц.Айсулу дополнительно ежегодно сеет многолетние картофель и зерновые культуры на 4,0 га земли, что приносит около 120,000 KGS каждый год. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айсулуа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуа будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aisulu is 29 years old and is the main source of income for her family.  She married in 2004 and immediately began working with livestock.  She started her business with only 15,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Aisulu today owns 4 cows and 4 horses, and she brings in around 10,000 KGS monthly from the sale of milk.  Additionally, she plants potatoes and corn each year on 4 hectares of land.  Her yearly income is around 120,000 from the sale of crops and livestock.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy more animals.  The income from the loan will be put back into the business for further expansion.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Clara Angela

texts.es: La Señora Clara  tiene 44 tiene dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 17  años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas, frazadas y otros artículos, ella ofrece sus productos a distintas oficinas, domicilios a crédito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Señora Clara  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de edredones por mayor ya que  esta época tiene mucha demanda y ella desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, La Señora Clara enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Clara is 44 years old and has two children, ages 15 and 17. She makes a livings selling a variety of quilts, sheets, blankets and other articles at distinct offices and homes on credit. This is her first loan with this institution, and Clara plans to use it to purchase a variety of quilts at wholesale because they are in high demand this time of year and she wants to stock her business. Her reason to request the loan is that some orders have been placed and she doesn't have the necessary capital for the products. Clara faces challenges with her business, such as competition and high seasonal demand, and plans to use the profits to continue increasing her merchandise and her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of quilts at wholesale.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is a resident living in Dongkor district, Phnom Penh. She is 60 years old and is in a common-law marriage with four children. She is a housewife who is responsible for the household and care for her children. Her husband works in the construction industry to provide income for this family and her three children who are currently employed provide another source of income. Sa’s children have experienced difficulties in their transportation needs because the work locations are far away from home.

She is now requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy her children’s needs. This motorcycle can help reduce their traveling costs. She believes that the loan will partially contribute to developing her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy her children’s needs.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озоде 21 лет. Она незамужем и в данное время живет вместе с родителями в районе Сарбанд. Озода независимая и самостоятельная девушка. Уже год как она работает продавцом. Сейчас Озода хочет открыть свой бизнес в торговой сфере. Она просит кредит для приобретения торговой точки и закупа сахара.
texts.en: Ozoda is 21 years old.  She has not yet married and currently lives with her parents in the Sarband region of Tajikistan.  She is an independent self-reliant woman.  She has worked as a salesgirl for one year.  Now, she wants to start her own business in the trade market.  She's asking for a loan to find a space from which to sell her goods, and to buy sugar.

loans.use: To rent a place to sell goods from and to buy sugar.

loans.name: Kashif

texts.en: Mr. Kashif owns a small hotel (restaurant) in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a 38-year-old hard working and honest man and a responsible father of two children. His children are students. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing a variety of food products including, flour, sugar, oil, pulses, rice, and vegetables for his hotel business. But due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of ingredients to make food for his restaurant

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony earns a living through a hog-raising business. He has been engaged in this venture for more than 10 years now.

Mark Anthony is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Ijaz Ali

texts.en: Mr. Ijaz Ali has been running an auto repair shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan which is the only source of income for the family. He is 42 years old and has four children. He has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase spare motor bike parts. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare motor bike parts.

loans.name: Cresentia

texts.en:
Cresentia is a 36-year-old, married mother of four children. She does dairy farming in Tala town. She supplies milk to various hotels as well as shop retailers. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past four years, and it has been profitable.

This will be her third loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy a dairy cow. This will enable her to increase her milk production and thereby generate more income with which she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In future, Cresentia hopes to buy more dairy cows and become one of the best and leading dairy farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es: El Sr. Ascencio tiene 59 años,  tiene dos hijos, el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles de cocina,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Mario Mercado de la ciudad de la Paz,   se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 30 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Ascencio utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de material de construcción para ampliación de su taller, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material ya que así tendrá mayor comodidad,   El Sr. Ascencio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Ascencio is 59 years old, has two children and works in the construction of doors and kitchen cabinets.  His carpentry shop is located in the Mario Mercado area of the city of La Paz.  He has been doing this kind of work for 30 years.  He learned this trade from his father who was also a carpenter.  This is his first loan with this institution.  Mr. Ascencio will use this loan to buy construction materials to enlarge his workshop.  The reason that he is requesting this loan is the lack of funds for the purchase of these materials, which will make his shop more comfortable.  Mr Ascencio faces challenges in his business, such as getting out of poverty.  He will use the proceeds to improve his quality of life.  This trade is the only activity that allows him to support himself and his family.  He therefore feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support that it brings him.

loans.use: to repair and enlarge his workshop.

loans.name: Malkia Group

texts.en:
Halfan, who is in his middle 30s, is married with three children, one boy and two girls. Two of them go to school and the other one is still young. He has been running a fruits and vegetable business and has a motorcycle. He has been in these businesses for three years now.  He works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halfan's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his stock in the genge (fruits and vegetables stall) and he bought spares and fuel for the motorcycle.  He has paid back the loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and bought a plot of land.  He dreams of building his own house.

Halfan will share this loan with his loan group MALKIA with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another fruits and vegetables business

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Prescila is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to sell more and increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en:
Chinh was born in 1954. She has a son and a daughter. They all have their own families. Her husband is dead. Chinh is a farmer. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong). She has done this job for 35 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Nelly De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Nelly de 54 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 21 años el cual está estudiando en la Universidad.  Ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En su ratos libres le gusta cocina un riquísimo plato típico de la región.” Indio Viejo” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria. Por lo cual lucha día a día para que su logre coronar una carrera y tenga un futuro mejor.
Gracia a  su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica  venta de cosa de horno, es un pan típico de la región; ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo la cosa de horno de forma ambulante, con una pana sobre su cabeza de unos 25 kg. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, porque es la fuente de ingresos y de su hijo. El objetivo del crédito en invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de cosa de horno como: maíz, cuajada, leña, gas, cal, azúcar, leche. Nelly agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Nelly is 54 years old and a single mother of a 21 year old son who is attending a university.  She is from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country.  In her free time she likes to cook a vary tasty local dish, called "Indio Viejo".  Unfortunately she was not able to attend a university because she did not have the financial resources.  She therefore struggles every day so that her son can get a career and have a better future.  Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, she has a business selling baked goods, making traditional breads of the region.  She works 10 hours a day and sells her baked goods as a street vendor, with a 25 kg tray on her head.  She does this work with much pleasure because this is the source of income for her son.  The reason for the loan is to invest in raw materials for the making of baked goods, such as corn meal, cheese, firewood, gas, sugar, milk.  Nelly is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with limited financial resources and countries such as Nicaragua, allowing for a way to have a respectable way to make a living.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the making of baked goods, buy raw materials such as corn meal, cheese, wood, gas, sugar, milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office materials including Internet services and a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fryer and a trailer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase envelopes, stamps, a printer and a fax machine.

loans.name: Tiaffo

texts.en:
As a professional musician, Tiaffo struggled to make peace with a band mate.  But the tension between them escalated and caused them to continually debate what type of music they should be creating. 

“The band wasn’t making the type of music I really like,” Tiaffo says, so he left the group to produce others’ music. “I thought it would be a good way to make money,” he says. He then opened Excelsior Media Concern, a media production company that creates and produces beats and music videos.

Most media producing companies in Tiaffo’s hometown of Little Rock focus only on rap.  His company does much more.  “In addition to rap, we work with pop, gospel, and other types of music,” he says.

The flexibility of creating his own schedule and having a job that allows him to express his creativity attracted Tiaffo to becoming self-employed.  “It was a matter of taking my strength and passion and just doing it.”

Starting out, he didn’t know much about creating and producing music, other than the fact that he loved it.  Most of what he learned was hands-on trial and error. The self-taught Tiaffo says he read a lot of books and articles on how to properly obtain his goal of making music and music videos for a living.

While researching the industry, Tiaffo read about Accion Texas Inc. in Black Enterprise Magazine. He later applied and was approved for a loan. 

For the last four years, Tiaffo has been the sole employee, but he plans to hire a small team later this summer. 

His website, www.tiaffo.com, is where he houses some of his beats. Tiaffo also showcases some of his own original music on his ReverbNation profile:  http://www.reverbnation.com/tiaffo#!/tiaffo/songs/.

loans.use: to pay for studio time.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
A decade of cell phone retail management experience taught Kevin that if you serve customers well, they’ll be loyal.  But before he could work, his parents taught him to be respectful and treat people the way he wants to be treated.

Therefore, high morale is what makes Cell Phone Accessory Store a successful venture.
Kevin not only offers cell phone accessories such as car chargers, batteries, cases, Bluetooth items, and stereo headsets – he also repairs broken screens, is an authorized Cricket Communications dealer, and provides utility bill pay.

Originally from Helena, Arkansas, Kevin and his wife decided to move to Little Rock in 1997 for greater work opportunities.  He has owned his new business for about a year and a half.

“When I came up with the idea to open an accessory store, I dealt with customers who just wanted to fix a problem – mostly trying to find accessories for older phones. We have a lot of customers who want only the basic phones. That makes our store a lot more unique. We offer accessories for every carrier. We’re not biased on the type of items we have.”

He says he enjoys the profitability that comes with being an entrepreneur. “I run my store just as I want to be treated,” he says. However, Kevin’s main goal is to earn financial freedom and to better provide for his family so they may continue to enjoy a comfortable lifestyle.

Currently, Kevin has two employees. As the business continues to grow, he’ll hire more.  He plans to cap his staff at 15 employees. His major goal is to open multiple stores. Before he gets to that point, he’ll need to expand his customer pool, which means increasing his inventory.

“I did a ton of searching for lending companies,” Kevin says. “Then a customer came in and mentioned Accion Texas Inc. about a year ago. I applied for a loan, but decided not to go through with it because I was doing fine. With the type of cash I was asking for, I decided to hold off.”

Later, when he did need a loan to ramp up his business, he remembered Accion and ventured into the Little Rock office to re-apply – and was approved.

His loan will help to purchase more inventory, and therefore, increase the potential for more sales. “I try to make sure I have everything. I only keep one or two of each product at a time,” Kevin says. “Other wireless stores send their customers to me if they don’t have an item. Once the customer gets in, they find out we offer utility bill pay and cheaper accessories. As I continue to make profit, I can stock two or three products. I can use the capital to purchase more of what I need.”

Without the loan, Kevin wouldn’t be able to serve as many customers. “Clients don’t want to wait, especially if they need something immediately,” he says. The Accion loan helps him stock multiples of everything, keep his customers happy and, most importantly, keep up with his competition. 

While he is currently working on a website, check out his Facebook page:  http://www.facebook.com/pages/Cell-Phone-Accessory-Store/192299987526794 and Google Plus page: https://plus.google.com/100506718754500603312/about?gl=us&hl=en#100506718754500603312/about?gl=us&hl=en.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone cases, batteries, chargers, Bluetooth accessories, stereo headsets, and cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a van and equipment and to cover insurance and office expenses.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en: Elguja is 40 years old. He is from the small village of Adigeni district. He is married and lives with his wife and three daughters (12,16, and 17 years old). The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Additionally, they have a plot of agricultural land, where haricot and potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets at a good price. Elguja requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, he will be able to expand the cattle and produce more cheese products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Elguja awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes de 54 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 16 años, originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. María se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable de buenas costumbres. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos. Ella lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo. Y darle mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracias a su espíritu de salir adelante y sus ganas de superación tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa  variada, desde hace 14 años, ubicado en el mercado  de la localidad. Actividad que consisten en vender ropa variada como pantalones, short, blusas, camisolas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, toallas. Ella dedica unas 10 horas diarias a su actividad. Actividad que la disfruta mucho porque ha sido el sustento de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa variada, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 54 years old.  She is married, has a 16 year old son and is originally from Managua, in the central part of the region.  María is a hard-working, responsible and respectable person.  Unfortunately she could not study at university due to a lack of money.  Every day she fights to provide her son with a better future and to give him better living conditions.

Thanks to her desire to move forward in life and her will to overcome problems, María has been making a living selling various items of clothing at the local market for 14 years.  This work consists of selling clothes such as trousers, shorts, blouses, sports shirts, underwear, bedclothes and towels.  She works around ten hours a day and she really enjoys it as it has been a way of supporting the family.  The aim for this loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock up her business of buying and selling various clothes.  The loan will hopefully soon result in a higher income.  María is grateful for the help that Kive investors provide to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua.  The help allows people to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business buying and selling various clothes, such as trousers, shorts, blouses, sports shirts, underwear, bedclothes and towels.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica  tiene  25  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  unos materiales para hacer unos arreglos a la vivienda. Ella además cuenta con una plantación de café la cual trabaja con el esposo y loa hijos  mucho esfuerzo con el anhelo de tener un mejor futuro y con este proyecto poder pagar este crédito, es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Mónica is 25 years old.  She is married and currently lives with her husband and three children.  With the loan she plans to buy some materials for fixing-up her home.  She also has a coffee plantation which she works with her husband and children.  They all put in a lot of effort as they have a strong desire to have a better future and with this project they will be able to repay the loan.  This is Mónica's first loan from Fudecosur.  She has not had any other loans from state banks before but Fudecosur has provided her with a loan under better conditions and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
El joven José Javier vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una empresa como cajero desde hace tres años vive  con sus padres se caracteriza por se un joven responsable, honesto, tiene muchos deseo de culminar su carrera universitaria.

José está solicitando un crédito para  el adelanto de una motocicleta que va a comprar  ya que  lo considera necesario para  trasladarse de su casa a su trabajo y a su centro de estudios. 

José  Javier agradece mucho kiva  y ceprodel porque con los crédito anteriores  los ha utilizado para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Young José Javier lives in the city of Managua and has worked as a cashier in a business for three years.  He lives with his parents and can be characterised as a responsible and honest young man with a strong will to complete his universities studies.

José is applying for a loan to make a down-payment on a motorcycle that he is going to buy.  He thinks the motorcycle is necessary for going between his home, work and university.

José is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel as he has used previous loans for his studies.

loans.use: to invest in buying a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayati

texts.en: Ayati runs a small stall where she sells cell phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. She is an entrepreneur who has four persons living in her house. She joined Ruma six months ago because she had planned to open a small stall. She is still really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. For the last three months, she has around $30 - 45/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payments on weekends

loans.name: Sariat

texts.en: The picture shows Sariat and his wife. Sariat runs a small stall where he sells stationary and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur who has four persons living in his house. His wife helps him to runs the stall. He joined Ruma three months ago because he wanted to expand to other business opportunities and still feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for his customers. For the last three months, he has around $55 - 65/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Galuh

texts.en: Galuh runs a small stall which sells cell phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she has been working as an employee in a medical clinic and has five persons living in her house. She joined Ruma five months ago and is still really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for the customers. Over the last three months, she has had around $ 90 - 100/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business gets going well, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en: Wahyu, who is usually called Ayu, runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, gas, groceries, etc. and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she has been working as a civil servant and has six persons living in her house. She joined Ruma a month ago because she wants to expand into other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credits and she still feels really excited to expand her business more and more. For the last month, she has had around $ 25 - 100/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: Don José, es un padre de tres hijos mayores de edad quienes estudian y trabajan para mantener su educación, don José con su esposa continua con su pequeño negocio de ropa usada y en la actualidad la camionetita que compro la tiene en alquiler para acarreo con estos ingresos se ayuda bastante para mantener la comida diaria de su familia. Solicita el crédito con el objetivo de levantar paredes de concreto de su casa, ya que son de laminas viejas de zinc, careciendo de protección y seguridad, necesitara comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y pagara la mano de obra, esta inversión le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, gracias al apoyo de financiamiento por el que está muy agradecido.
texts.en:
José has three adult children who study and work to pay for their education.  José and his wife continue to run their small business selling used clothing and he rents out the van he bought to earn extra income to put food on the table.

He is requesting a loan to build concrete walls in his house since the old sheet metal is wearing out and does not provide protection and safety.  He needs to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron and to hire workers.  This investment will improve his family's living conditions.  He is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: To buy blocks, cement, sand and iron, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Venancio Uriel

texts.es:
El Señor Venacio Uriel es profesor docente de uno de los colegios públicos de la ciudad de león desde hace mas de 20 años siendo este trabajo el sustento de su familia.

El Señor Venancio labora para un colegio que queda a larga distancia de su casa de habitación por lo que sintió la necesidad de comprar un medio de transporte para agilizar en el traslado a su centro de trabajo por lo que se acercó a ceprodel y Kiva a solicitar  apoyo para  la compra de una motocicleta.
texts.en:
Venacio Uriel is teacher at a public school in the city of León where he has worked for 20 years to maintain his family.

The school Venancio works for is considerably far from his house so he feels the need to buy some mode of transport to get him to worker quicker.  He has requested a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 54 años, casado, padre de 7 hijos, 4 de ellos en edad escolar aun, se dedica a la actividad económica de compra y venta de ganado para crianza el realiza sus compras en las comarcas aledañas a la zona que él vive compra al contado y vende en el municipio y comarcas de donde él vive a comerciantes que ya son clientes fijos, él es una persona muy trabajadora relata que empezó su negocio hace 30 años a muy temprana edad porque sus padres eran muy pobres y no tuvieron capacidad económica para brindarles estudios profesionales y por tal razón decidió dedicarse a esta actividad. Él es el sostén económico de una familia muy trabajadora que desde temprano  se levantan a trabajar y ayudar a que el ganado se mantenga bien cuidado y no lo ataque ningún tipo de enfermedad o le falte alimento. Pedro solicita este crédito para comprar materia prima como: varias vacas preñadas entre otros
texts.en:
Pedro, 54, is married and has two school-aged children, 7 and 4 years old.  He is in the business of buying and selling cattle.  He buys them in the villages near where he lives and always pays in cash.   He has a fixed customer base and sells to the merchants in the town and neighboring counties.  A very hard worker, he says he began his business 30 years ago when he was young.  Since his parents were poor and unable to give him a career, he went into farming.

He is the head of household of a hard-working family and gets up early in the morning to go out to care for the cattle, making sure they are healthy and well fed.  Pedro is requesting this loan to buy more cattle, especially bred cows.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Annia

texts.es: Annia  tiene  27  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Annia is 27 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband and son. Through the loan she hopes to buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide, and in turn, use them to help with labour. She hopes to keep her crops in good condition so they undergo less damage and production yield is not reduced. In this way her coffee crops can generate more earnings for her family. 

She doesn't have enough money to buy these products as she has a low income and no other way of obtaining capital, so she is asking for a loan. It will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR. She hasn't taken out a loan before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has made it easier for her to take out a loan with them and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar una motocicleta, con la finalidad de poderse trasladar a una propiedad que tienen  para poder dar una mejor asistencia y la cual está sembrada de café y obtener mejores resultados en la producción  ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Víctor, a 33-year-old entrepreneur, is married and lives with his wife.  He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to travel to his coffee plantation so he can take better care of the crop and improve production.  This is the main source of income for the family to get ahead.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan and FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Levis Guillermo

texts.es:
Levis Guillermo de 40 años de edad,  casado con dos hijos menores de edad de 11,9 años de edad, originaria de Managua lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Levis es una persona que se destaca por su amabilidad, responsabilidad, y sus ganas de superación personal; lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería en sistema.

Gracias a su espíritu de superación personal, tiene por actividad económica la venta de CD, desde hace 20 años, y está ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. El negocio consiste en vender CD grabado con música, y películas en una gran variedad. La rutina de trabajo de Levis es de unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la disfruta mucho,  porque es la forma que tiene para la subsistencia de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de CD, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Levis Guillermo agradece la  ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Levis Guillermo, 40, is married and has two minor children, ages 11 and 9.  He is from Managua which is in the central part of the country.  Levis stands out because of his kindness, responsibility and determination to improve his personal situation.  Unfortunately, he was unable to get a college degree but he would like to have studied systems engineering.

Thanks to his spirit of self improvement, he has been selling CD's for 20 years at one of the best markets in town.  He sells a wide variety of music and film CD's.  His work routine is spending 12 hours a day offering his products, which he enjoys very much since it is his main source of income for the family.

The loan will be used as working capital to buy and sell CD's in an effort to increase his future income.  Levis Guillermo is grateful to Kiva lenders who help people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua to earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy music and film CD's.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy domestic animals

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab lives in the village of Didvela in the Baghdati district. He is married and lives together with his 35-year-old wife, parents and three children, who are all going to school. The total income of the family is 900 Lari per month, which comes from agriculture activities. In particular, they have six cows and a vineyard. They milk the cows to make dairy products and sell it locally. From the harvested grapes the family makes wine which is also sold locally at the markets. With the requested loan Zurab plans to build a greenhouse, where different kinds of vegetables will be grown seasonally. He will purchase wood and polyethylene materials for covering the greenhouse and with a little part of the credit he will buy seeds for the vegetables. Later he will grow and harvest the product and then sell them at the markets. The profit will be used for reinvesting and developing his agricultural business and Zurab will have more income to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood and polyethylene materials for building a greenhouse and vegetable seeds to plant inside.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is now 56 years old and happily living with her family. Apart from her cereals business Salina owns a retail shop that has been operational for a period of six years, earning an income of KES. 18,000.

She is now her fourth loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and she wishes to pay school fees for her two children who are in various secondary schools. The profits she earns from her business will be used to pay the loan and also add stock to her business.

Her dream is to ensure they get the best education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sarwat

texts.en:
Sarwat owns a small clothing business in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She purchases variety of clothes from the main city and and sells them in her community.
She is a 41-year-old, hard-working and honest woman and a responsible mother of 2 children. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is currently in need of purchasing a variety of clothing to sell. But, due to financial constraints, she finds it difficult. Therefore, she has requested a loan for 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her to grow her business but will also increase her net income and savings. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a 26-year-old married man and a father of a 3-year-old son from Ubay, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income.
Ricky is asking for a loan to pay for the renewal of his driver's license. In the future, Rocky hopes of improving his business and exploring another venture to augment his income. He also plans to save money for the future schooling of his son.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of the driver's license.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 51 years old and married with three children.
Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries like bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other items.
Emelia has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.
Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries like bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other items.

loans.name: Dockers Group

texts.en:
Mishehe, who is in his early 20s is married with one son who has just started school. He has been a carpenter for six years now. He works from 8.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be Mishehe's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for increasing his stock of wood. He dreams of building his own house.
Mishehe will share this loan with his loan group "Dockers" which is ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood of CPG, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 59 years old, married and supports her child who is still in school. She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of over 15 years and her monthly income is KES. 15,000.
She is now requesting her second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stocks of fresh bread, sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat and cereals. The profits she earns will be used to plough back to business.
Her dream is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, rice, and fresh bread for her retail store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling soft drinks .She has been in this business for 10 years selling to all types of people on a retail and wholesale basis. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits. She works six days out of every week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to start supplying fruit juice to other shops and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits.

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.fr: Dorothée est une dame âgée de 44 ans, divorcée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 12 et 18 an. elle mène une activité de vente de céréales dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans déjà. ceci dire elle bénéfice d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des sacs d'arachides et de pistaches pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses capacités de vente. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille devenus trop important depuis son divorce.
texts.en: Dorothée is a 44-year old lady, who is divorced and mother to three children, whose ages range between 12 and 18 years old. She has been selling cereals in one of the town's markets for the past 15 years and thus enjoys good experience in this field. With this loan she would like to buy sacks of groundnut and pistachios in order to boost her stock of goods and consequently her sales capacity. The income she generates will allow her to provide better for her family's needs, which have become too heavy since her divorce.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jean Rene

texts.fr: Jean est un homme camerounais de 41 ans.Marié et père de 05 enfants dont le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé 08 mois, Jean  fait essentiellement dans la vente de boissons hygiéniques depuis 03 ans.son stock de marchandise étant moindre, Jean souhaite acheter les boissons hygiéniques afin de renforcer son stocks et également quelques produits alimentaires afin de diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses bénéfices. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et lui permettront également d'assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Jean is a 41-year old man from Cameroon. He is married and father to five children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest eight months. Jean has mainly been selling hygienic drinks for the past three years, but as his stock of goods has fallen he would like to buy more hygienic drinks so that he can boost it again and also buy some food products so that he can diversify his business and increase his profits. The profits he makes will be reinvested in his business and will also enable him to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy hygienic drinks.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr: Donatien est un jeune homme agé de 31 ans.pour subvenir à ses besoins,il s'est lancé après ses études dans la commercialisation des boissons alcooliques et des jus.il exerce comme activité secondaire,la vente des divertissements par jeux vidéos.le client souhaite reinvestir les bénéfices dans sa structure et améliorer également ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Donatien is a young man, who is 31 years old. In order to provide for his needs he began selling alcoholic drinks and juices once he had finished his studies. He has a secondary activity selling video games. The customer would like to reinvest his profits in his business and also improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his stock (drinks, crates of beer, juice and food products).

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 31-year-old conservative woman. She has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Nisreen is a mother of three. Her husband has his own business of selling mobile phones to support the family. Nisreen is applying for a loan to purchase more mobile phones and their accessories for him to sell.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag, who is 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her father-in law-has two houses on his fenced land and she, together with her family, lives in one of the houses. She has been working as a hairdresser at her own barbershop for eleven years and during this time she has attracted quite a number of people to her business as well as accumulated vast amounts of experience in this service field. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase new furniture for her home. As a result, her family will live in a more comfortable place and this will motivate her and her husband to work even harder and more enthusiastically. The borrower is one of our organization's trustworthy clients and has paid her previous loan's installment debt in due time.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is applying for a loan of 29,000 PHP to purchase more groceries and ingredients to sell in her general store.  This business, that was previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and Kiva, continues to provide for Susan and her family with an increased income and continues to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Khasa

texts.en:
Khasa is a 53-year-old from Imishli. She has 3 children. Khasa has been raising cattle for the past 20 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but her brother is helping her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the market. Khasa has 5 daughters and believes she must work very hard in order to help with her daughters’ weddings. 

Khasa usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens and sells them in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is about 250 AZN. This is the only income source for the family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its frequent use in everyday meals.

Khasa is applying for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy 4 calves and 2 cows. This is going to be her first loan with Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy four calves and two cows.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile. Eman is a married woman from Jabalia. She lives in a simple house with her husband and two sons. Her husband works for a low wage, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

She is requesting a 2,517 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer Eman comfortable furniture so she can enjoy living in her house.

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy new living room furniture for the family home.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man living in Rafah city with his wife. For the past 2 years, he has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. 

He would like to buy a new taxi but he needed some money to pay the remaining cost of the car. Mohammad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him pay the remaining cost of the taxi.  Mohammad appears in the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of the taxi.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil is a 40 year-old-man with 3 children. He is from Imishli. He grows fruits and sells them. Habil has been in this business for 10 years. As his pension is not enough to cover his family needs, he runs this business with support of his wife. 

Habil grows fruits and sells them in the market for profit. His monthly income from this business is 300 AZN. Since he is retired, Habil’s family is highly dependent on this salary. In Azerbaijan fruits are in a very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruits a lot. Besides his fruit sales, he also sells flowers. 

Habil is really optimistic about the future regarding the expansion of his business. He believes it will improve the living conditions of his family. To this end he has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN. Habil has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest before. He is considered a good customer.

loans.use: to buy garden tools, seeds and fertilisers in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is a 48-year-old single mother. For 10 years Lala has been operating her store. She usually sells products daily. There are tea, sugar, rice, candy, sauces, beans and other food items in her store. Single-handedly she has been managing this store and believes it is fun to have good contacts with customers.

Lala’s store is in the central market of Agjabadi. There are daily customers who come to purchase the items they need. Her monthly income from the business is about 250 AZN. With the money she gets from store she takes care of her parents and also supports her relatives financially. She is a person who always works hard in order to achieve more.

Lala has taken a loan once before from Aqroinvest. She has applied for a second loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money she plans to purchase more products, because very soon there is a big spring holiday. Nowruz is coming and a lot of customers purchase goods.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase sales.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann, along with her husband, have been earning a living through fishing for more than two years now. Rose Ann works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine with which her husband will be able enhance his catch thus enabling them to sell more fish in the market. Rose Ann dreams of expanding their business in the future to generate more income necessary for the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is a 35-year-old woman from a small village of Terjola district. She is married and lives with her husband, her 9-year-old daughter, her 11-year-old son, and her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. Her husband works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have two milk cows which Eka milks and uses to produce cheese products to sell at local markets. Besides this they have a vineyard with 1000 samples of wine trees and a hectare of agricultural land. They harvest grapes and produce wine and Georgian Vodka to sell at a good price. 

Eka has requested a loan so that she can start trading in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and resell them with a price markup. This will increase the family's income which will enable them to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Novy

texts.en: This time, Novy is borrowing Php 20,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. Her general store business was previously funded through NWTF, and Kiva continues to provide her and her family with increased income that is improving their quality of life.
