Bintu is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because of the quality of education in the city.  In 2009, Bintu established her frozen fish business. She began her business to aid her husband in solving family issues. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city. Her main customers are women. Working seven days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL a month. 

Bintu is requesting a loan for 4,500,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase frozen fish to sell. She hopes that this loan will increase her profits. In the future, Bintu plans to get one cool room for herself to start generating income.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 28 and 22 years. In 1992, Fatmata established her materials, cottons, lace, etc., business. She began her business to help her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more materials for resale. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level and help her to access more profits.   

In the future, Fatmata plans to become a supplier to many schools, supplying different types of uniforms. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more clothing materials.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta tiene 46 años, es divorciada y con 2 hijos pequeños con quienes reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe.Dedicada inicialmente a las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad, optó desde hace 5 años en iniciar su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de abarrotes. En todo el tiempo transcurrido ha logrado establecer su negocio como un buen sustento para su economía familiar. A base de la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y demás comestibles ha logrado convertirse en una persona muy conocida además de entablar muy buenas amistades. El tema del transporte desde la ciudad hasta su localidad generan el incremento de los productos que expende , como es necesario surtir con mercadería su negocio acude a su entidad financiera para lograr obtener capital de trabajo.Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería consistente en sacos de arroz, azúcar , fideos , enlatados y cereales.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 46, is divorced and has two small children who live with her in an adobe house.  

Working exclusively in farming activities related to cacao and organic coffee production in her town, she decided five years ago to start her own grocery store business.  In this time she has managed to establish her business as a good means of support for her family finances.  Selling necessities such as rice, sugar, and other food products she has managed to become a very well-known person and start very good friendships.

Transportation from the city to her town creates an increase in the products she sells and it's necessary to stock the merchandise in her store.  She's going to her financial institution to get working capital.

Her long-term goals are to build her house of quality materials to improve her family's quality of life.

Currently she needs to have 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and cereals.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen studies at Yerevan State Medical University under Mkhitar Heratsi in the department of general medicine. Vazgen is a very hardworking and proactive young man. It is very important for him to get a higher education and become a good specialist. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for him to cover his education costs. So, Vazgen has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan is very important for him to complete his education, find a job, and sustain his family.

Vazgen lives with his parents and is from Abovyan town.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: La Bendicion De Dios Toto Group

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es casada tiene 42 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a bordar guipiles; inició este negocio ayudando a su madre y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para poder realizar sus bordados, en el futuro quiere tener trabajadoras para producir en mayor cantidad. Los demas integrantes del grupo, tambien se dedican a bordar y a tejer cortes típicos.
texts.en:
Micaela, 42, completed three years of elementary school.  She has five children three of which are attending school.  She embroiders traditional skirts.  She started the business helping her mother and to date has 15 years’ experience.  

She organized a group to request a loan she’ll use to buy embroidery thread to do her embroidery.  In future she’d like to hire workers to produce in larger amounts.  The other group members also work embroidering and knitting traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread.

loans.name: Raina

texts.ru: Райне 50 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Райна на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Райны в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 дойные коровы и 2 теленка. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Райны позволяют оплачивать обучение ее детей в школе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Райна планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.Ведь ей предстоит обучить детей в университете.
texts.en:
Raina is 50 years old, married, and has two children. For the past five years, Raina has been engaged in raising livestock, starting with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS). Through hard work, Raina today has on her farm three dairy cows and two calves. 

With income from the business activities, Raina can pay for her children's school education. In order to further develop her business, Raina turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. 

Raina plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing her domestic livestock. After all, she plans to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур, замужем, воспитала 3 детей, дети учатся в школе. В 2006 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Айнур начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания со стартовой суммой в 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Айнур сумела развить свой бизнес. На доходы от бизнеса, Айнур смогла построить дом для семьи. Айнур обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение 2 овец и 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Ainur is married, has two children who are studying in school. In 2006 in search of a source of income for her family, Ainur began her own business trading in food products with a starting sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Through perseverance and hard work, Ainur was able to develop her business. With the income from the business, Ainur was able to build a home for her family. 

Ainur approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two sheep and a cow. 

Ainur plans to invest income from the loan in the development of her business and increasing the count of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep and one cow

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Idriss from Grassfield in the eastern area of Freetown. He is the father of two children between the ages of five and ten. Despite the challenges he faces, he is a very hardworking man who wants to educate his children. 

For ten years, Idriss has been running a general merchant business within his community. He started his business because he did not go to school. He sells peak milk, rice, mayonnaise, flour, and cigarettes. He works at this business throughout the week, and he does not have any source of income except his business. At present he is facing challenges such as bad weather conditions and price fluctuations. 

Idriss has requested a loan in order to buy more general food stuffs like rice, mayonnaise, flour, and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve the standard of living of his family. In the future, he plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more general food stuffs.

loans.name: Samwel Kamau

texts.en:
Samwel, a father of one and husband to one has lived in Viwandani, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya since 1985. He currently runs a renowned butchery that serves the population near his residence and has also invested in rental houses that help him meet his needs.

The Fresh Life idea was introduced to him by a close friend who works at the Fresh Life Initiative Limited. Investing in two Fresh Life toilets will ensure that his neighbours, his family and himself have access to sanitation at a nearby location by reducing the distance currently covered to visit other toilets in the area. This will in turn make the environment cleaner. A Fresh Life toilet is a better choice for him because it does not use water while the rest of the sanitation facilities in his area use water which occasionally runs out.

Samwel hopes to add more toilets. His dream in life is to educate his child to the highest level and grow as a business person.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 47 años, es viuda y tiene un hijo de 14 años con quien vive en su casa construida a base adobe.
Hace 6 años logro abrir un restaurant y lo ha convertido en un buen sustento para la economía familiar.
Comenta que al inicio solo tenía conocimientos básicos en cuanto a la preparación de platos comerciales pero ha logrado enriquecer sus conocimientos por el requerimiento de sus clientes ,y por está razon su local se ha convertido en un lugar muy concurrido por trabajadores agrícolas y transportistas del lugar.
Le agrada su trabajo puesto que se siente bien de tener tanta clientela. 
A manera de realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio desea contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera .Sus objetivo a largo plazo están en la construcción de su vivienda para posteriormente habilitarlo y desempeñar su negocio evitando así el pago de alquiler.En esta ocasión requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles y proceder con el pintado de su local así como la renovación de meses y sillas.
texts.en:
Luisa, 47, is a widow; she has a 14-year-old son who lives with her in an adobe house.  Six years ago she managed to open a restaurant that has become the source of her family’s support.  She comments that at the beginning she only had basic skills with respect to commercial cooking but she’s succeeded in enriching her knowledge to meet customer requirements.  Because of this, her restaurant has become very popular with local agricultural and transportation workers.  She enjoys her work because she feels good having such a large clientele.

She needs help from your financial institution in order to make some business improvements.  Her long-term goal is to build her house and then equip it for her business so she can save on rental costs.  On this occasion, she needs 2,000 new soles to proceed with painting her restaurant as well as with upgrading the tables and chairs.

loans.use: to paint her restaurant and upgrade its furniture.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Yerevan. She lives with her husband, eight year old daughter Hasmik, and sixteen year old son Hayk. Together with her husband, Gohar works hard to sustain her family and cover basic costs. 

Gohar's son Hayk studies in the economic department at the Armenian-European College Fund. It is very difficult for Gohar to cover her family's needs and save money for Hayk's education at the same time.  She is applying for this loan to pay for her son’s university tuition, which will give Hayk an opportunity to complete his education.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 33-year-old tomato seller. She is married to Patrick, a 37-year-old trader. They have a child and reside at Glefe. 

Gladys has been in this trade for the past six years and is still doing well in the Dansoman community. She is hardworking and industrious.
 
This is Gladys's fourth loan, and she needs 700 GHS to buy more tomatoes to meet her customers' demands. Gladys joined ID Ghana in 2011 when she was introduced by a friend.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 36 years old, and she sells slippers and shoes. She has been in this business for the past six years, and she is doing very well. Martha is a very dedicated and hardworking individual.

Martha is applying for her sixth loan and needs 800 GHS to buy more slippers and shoes to sell to her customers in the Dansoman community. She joined ID Ghana in 2008 through another beneficiary of the credit scheme. She has since taken five loans from ID and has been able to repay them without any default.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a Peruvian artisan who creates silver jewelry that showcases Andean gemstones. She'd like to invest in silver and gems to increase production.

Leslie has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"I have always been interested in art. It was natural choice to study design. After that I studied jewelry design, which I've practiced since 2003. Making jewelry offers me a sanctuary away from the world where I can do what I want. I love art and three-dimensional pieces, and I love to be able to touch what I create in my mind. To me, my craft is like a magical experience that allows me to express what I feel through silver and gems.

"I want to thank those who are helping fund this micro-credit from the bottom of my heart. It feels so good when a person who needs help finds a source of support, and even more when they aren't asking for anything in return. That's when we realize that there are always people who are willing to give a hand to others. Many thanks, and may God bless you."

Use the link below to view Leslie's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6660

loans.use: to invest in silver and gems to increase production of her crafts.

loans.name: Michael Andres

texts.es:
El cliente Michael vive en Guayaquil, tiene 19 años de edad. El empezó su negocio desde que sus padres se separaron y él se quedo con su papá, fue el papá que le enseño esta actividad de venta de especias para la comida. 
Este trabajo lo realiza solo desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00  o  4:00  y después ayuda a su papá en un taller de autos.

Le teme a la delincuencia ya que por donde él vive y tiene el negocio es una zona muy peligrosa.
No está casado, no tiene hijos, por lo tanto con lo que el gana en el trabajo va para los gastos del hogar y para su sustento propio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar especies. El sueño que quiere realizar en un futuro es poner una distribuidora de Especias en un local a mayor consumo. Y así poder tener más dinero y ayudar en su papá en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Michael lives in Guayaquil and is 19 years old. He started his business after his parents separated and he stayed with his father. It was his father who taught him this business of selling food spices.

He does this work on his own from 7 in the morning to 3 or 4 in the afternoon, and then helps his father in an auto repair shop.

He is afraid of crime, as the area where he lives and has his business is very dangerous.

He is not married and has no children, so what he earns in his work goes toward the household expenses and for supporting himself.

With the loan he wants to buy spices. His dream for the future is to set up a wholesale spice distributorship at a shop, and this way be able to have more money and help his father with his needs.

loans.use: To buy food spices.

loans.name: Sakish

texts.ru: Сакиш 56 лет, вдова, имеет 3 детей. В 1996 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Сакиш начала бизнес в животноводстве со сбережений в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство насчитывает 1 корова, 1 бычок.Сакиш обрабатывает 0,84 га земли  ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов, перепродажи скота и полеводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сакиш обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота - молодняка. В будущем, Сакиш хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sakish is 56 years old, widowed, and has three children. In 1996 in search of a source of income for her family, Sakish began a business in raising animals with savings in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Through tenacity and perseverance, Sakish today has on her farm one cow and one bull. Sakish works 0.84 hectares of land for a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS) from the sale of dairy products, resold cattle, and crops. 

In order to further develop her business, Sakish turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional heads of young cattle. 

In the future, Sakish wants to expand the farm and her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 39 лет, не замужем, воспитывает 2 дочерей. В 2002 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Нургул начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Нургул сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Нургул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения ассортимента товара в магазине. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует приобрести магазин, так как данные магазин она арендует.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 39 years old, unmarried, and raising two daughters. In 2002 in search of a source of income for her family, Nurgul began her own business selling food products. Through perseverance and hard work, Nurgul was able to develop her business with a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). 

At present, the range of products is not abundant and for this reason Nurgul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to expand the product assortment in her store. 

With income from the loan, Nurgul plans to buy a store, since she currently rents the current space.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods in the store

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials like sterling silver and leather so he can increase production.

Henry has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I was born in Jakarta, but I studied in the United States and traveled to Japan and Europe. Jewelry is my passion, and my work let me gain experience in jewelry design and crafting. I moved to Bali in 2002 and established my own workshop. My collections are influenced by my Indonesian surroundings and my admiration of Japanese artistry. Designing jewelry for men has become an intrinsic part of my lifestyle.

"I am really happy and grateful for this microcredit because it will help me to continue with my production. Thanks for all of your support and good thoughts, it really helps us grow."

Use the link below to view Henry's sterling silver and leather jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7116

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials like sterling silver and leather so he can increase production.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved traditional African furnishings, ceremonial items, and masks. He hopes to stock up on materials for his beautiful wood carvings.

Nana has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I am currently the chief carver for the king of the Ashanti because of my great ability in carving. Some of my work for the king includes objects with the gye nyame (symbol for the supremacy of God), stools, staffs, and other royal and ceremonial objects. I have trained and qualified about ten men in the art of skilled carving. I draw inspiration from traditional kente cloth designs, from my family background, and from our rich Ashanti tradition. 

My dream has always been to invest in my children's education. I am happy to say that this is now possible – two of my sons are in university, they are the first of our family to obtain a higher education. My other primary goal is to help my community so that the poverty that plagues them will be eradicated completely. Above all, I wish to help make it possible for peace and tranquility to prevail in my community and the nation of Ghana as a whole.

I am most grateful to the donors for helping me. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nana's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1482

loans.use: to stock up on materials for his wood carvings.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks and drums. He would like to hire additional artisans as well as invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood and polish for production.

Eric has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"During school summer holidays, I would visit my brother, who taught me how to carve. With help from my family, especially my brother, I was able to open my own workshop in the town where I grew up. Sese, a common wood harvested in eastern Ghana, is my primary material. Masks and profiles comprise the majority of my art. My inspiration comes naturally, although sometimes I carve based on my customers' ideas.

I thank the people who funded this microcredit. I promise to work very hard to make the repayment on time."

Use the link below to view Eric's African masks and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2275

loans.use: to hire additional artisans and to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood and polish for production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Maria.  She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 11 years. 

In 2000, Maria established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she wanted to help her family and husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in outskirts of the city and her main customers are women. Working seven days per week and 12 hours per day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Maria would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase frozen fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will automatically increase her profit because of the increase in stock level. 

In the future, Maria plans to become supplier of fish to the provinces like Bo, Kenema, Makeni, Lunsar, etc. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen fish for her business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия родом из Виноградово, Западная Украина. Она торгует кондитерскими изделиями – тортами, пирожками, пирожными – со своей торговой точки. Наталия занимается этим бизнесом уже 12 лет. В свое время Наталия решила заниматься этим делом, потому что ей очень нужна была работа. Наталия решила попробовать себя в этой сфере, увидела, что это выгодный бизнес и продолжила развиваться в этом направлении. 
Сумма в 20 000 гривен понадобилась Наталии, чтобы закупить больше нового товара, а именно печенья, шоколада, пирожных, конфет и вафель. Бизнес Наталии хорошо поставленный, стабильный, доход постоянный. Она планирует развиваться и дальше, постепенно расширяя свое дело.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a native of Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. She sells sweets – cakes, pies, pastries – from her market stall. 

Nataliya has been engaged in this business for 12 years. At the time, Nataliya decided to pursue this activity because she really needed a job. Nataliya decided to try her hand in this field,  saw that it was good business, and continued to develop in this direction. 

Nataliya needed a sum of 20,000 hryvnia in order to buy more new products, such as cookies, chocolate, pastries, candy, and wafers. Nataliya's business is well-supplied, stable, and has a steady income. She plans to develop further, gradually expanding her activities.

loans.use: to buy more new products, such as cookies, chocolate, pastries, candy, and wafers

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Salamatu. She is a widow and has two children, aged nine and six years. She has three additional dependents that live with her and help with the house chores and the business. 

In 1999, Salamatu established her clothing business selling jeans, headbands, and other items. She began her business because she wanted to become self reliant after losing her husband. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,806,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.

Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy more bags, jeans, and blouses for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business into a shop. The competition is average, but she is able to cope because of her time in the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and plastic slippers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a Ghanaian designer specializing in hand-carved wood art. She would like to invest in the purchase of wood, aluminum plate, and polish for production.

Anna has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I got the opportunity to work as an art vendor and developed an interest in arts and crafts. I sketch the designs on paper, then work closely with skilled artisans as they do the carving. I love that there is no waste of wood. Every small piece of wood can be used to create small creatures. I have trained two people and now provide jobs for ten artisans. My design work helps me pay for my children's education."

I will use this microcredit to craft new items to increase my workshop's production. I thank the contributors for thinking about me."

Use the link below to view Anna's designs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8067

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, aluminum plate, and polish for production.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: Marie est une femme camerounaise de 60 ans. Mère de 08 enfants, marie a à sa charge actuellement 03 enfants. Marie confectionne les vêtement depuis 25 ans, étant obligé chaque fois de se rendre dans un marché de la ville afin de surfiler des vêtement Marie souhaiterait avec l'argent du crédit acheter une sur fileuse afin de gagner en temps et en argent. les bénéfices obtenus lui permettront d'assurer le bien être de sa famille et l'éducation des enfants encore à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mary is a 60-year-old woman from Cameroon. She is the mother of eight children, three of whom are currently dependents.

Mary has been making garments for 25 years, and always has to go to a market in town to overcast (technique to strengthen sewing) her clothing. Marie would like to use the loan to buy an overcasting machine to save time and money.

Benefits obtained will enable her to ensure her family's well-being and the education of the children still under her care.

loans.use: Buy an overcasting machine (sewing)

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine est un homme marié de 31 ans et sans enfant.  Il vit avec sa femme chez lui même dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Il a abandonné les études en classe de 6ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour apprendre auprès de son oncle la menuiserie, afin de subvenir à ses besoins personnels  tout en aidant son père dans les dépenses de la famille. Après il décide d’ouvrir un  atelier de menuiserie situé à Faraba qui est un quartier de Bougouni. Avec 10 années d’expérience, il maîtrise son activité. Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant il  décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 25 planches de bois, 15  contre paquet  des cartons de pointes, vernis et colles. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni. La vente de ses articles se fait dans son atelier. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale. Il est très sollicité par ses clients pour la qualité de ses articles. Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Ce qui lui permettra de d’améliorer son entreprise et à payer les intérêts. Il envisage agrandir son atelier.
texts.en:
Lamine is a 31-year-old married man with no children. He lives with his wife in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni. 

Lamine stopped going to school in the sixth year of primary school (in the Malian education system) to be a woodworking apprentice under his uncle in order to support his needs while helping his father with the household expenses. 

Afterwards, he decided to open a woodworking workshop in Faraba, which is a neighborhood in Bougouni. He has been doing this for the last ten years. 

To supplement his cash flow, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso so he could buy 25 planks of wood and 15 cartons of nails, glue, and varnish. He procures his supplies in Bougouni. 

He sells what he makes from his workshop. His customers are mostly locals. He is highly sought after for his quality work.

With this loan Lamine hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. This will allow him to improve his business and to pay the interest [on his loan]. He hopes to one day expand the size of his workshop.

loans.use: to buy woodworking materials

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 66 year old man from a small village in the Kobuleti District.  He is married and lives with his wife, Dodo, 35 year old son, and 36 year old daughter.

Dodo works as a teacher at a local school and earns a monthly income.  Zaur works at local auto school where he teaches driving.  In addition to these jobs, the family is involved in an agricultural business.  They have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize, a hundred nut trees, and different kinds of citrus.  Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. 

Zaur is requesting a loan that will allow him to cultivate the land and purchase fertilizers. After the land is cultivated and fertilized, the harvest will be more profitable. This will increase his family's income. With increased income, Zaur will be able to improve his family's living conditions.  Zaur awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Vitaliya

texts.ru:
Виталия торгует детской одеждой торговой марки «Bebeto». Раньше, имея собственное помещение, она сама не использовала его под магазин для торговли, а сдавала в аренду одному местному банку. Два года назад Виталия достроила второе помещение рядом и теперь открыла там свой небольшой магазинчик. 
Виталии нужна сумма в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы выкупить партию фирменного товара у своего партнера ТМ «Bebeto, которую она потом будет реализовывать на своей торговой точке. Виталия очень предана своему делу, она порядочная и целеустремленная. Летом она перенесла операцию на глаза, теперь зрение намного улучшилось и работать она снова может в полную силу.
texts.en:
Vitaliya sells children's clothes of the Bebeto brand. Previously, having her own premises, she did not use it for a trade shop, but instead rented it out to a loacal bank. Two years ago, Vitaliya finished a second premises next door and now has opened a small shop.

Vitaliya needs a sum of 20,000 hryvnia to buy brand goods from her partner Bebeto(TM), which she will then sell at her market stall. Vitaliya is very dedicated to her work; she is decent and purposeful. In the summer, she had an operation on her eyes. Her vision is much improved now and she can work in full force.

loans.use: to buy brand goods from her partner Bebeto(TM), which she will then sell at her market stall

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Kaday. She is married and has three children aged five, seven, and eighteen. 

In 2010, Kaday established her provisions and drinks business. She began her business after graduating from college. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 1,650,000 SLL every month.

Kaday would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans. Kaday now requires a new loan in order to buy more drinks for sale. In the future, Kaday plans to expand to trade in imported rice. The competition is low. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mayonnaise, butter, and milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has seven children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells wakey (a traditional Ghanaian rice dish) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast), which she has done for 30 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Esi uses her income to help her support her husband and pay the family's general expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare her wakey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further expand her enterprise and venture into newer markets.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her wakey recipe.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Umaru. He is married and has three children aged three, eight, and twelve. 

In 2000, Umaru established his plastic products business. He began his business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,890,000 SLL every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Umaru has already received and successfully repaid three loans. He requires a loan in order to purchase more of his stock items for resale. 

In the future, Umaru plans to move to a shop and expand to see his business grow. The competition is low, and the business is good as it is in the center of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and plastic products for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells fried fish in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a mason. 

Ama has been selling fried fish since she was 15 years old. She helps support her husband by paying some of the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of fish to fry and sell in the market. 

Ama hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her fried fish trade further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of fish to fry and sell in the market.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mabinty. She is married and has five children aged 7, 10, 14, 19, and 22. She has one additional dependent who lives with her and helps with the household chores. 

In 1998, Mabinty established her fish business because she wanted to help her husband provide for their home. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,261,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. 

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more fish for sale. In the future, she plans to expand to trade in palm oil, pepper, and local foodstuffs. The competition is high, but Mabinty is able to cope since she also does wholesale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 49 años de edad, nacido en la ciudad de León, casado, tiene una pulpería desde hace 9 años, es padre de 6 hijos. 
El negocio de la pulpería le pertenecía a su madre pero ella se lo heredo a él y desde entonces se  ha convertido en su único negocio y con el cual mantiene a su familia. Cuatro de sus hijos están estudiando y los otros dos viven independientes. Las tareas laborales las comparte junto con su esposa mientras él hace las compras para surtir el negocio su esposa le ayuda atender el negocio y los fines de semanas sus hijos lo apoyan en la pulpería para que su mama pueda descansar. Es así como juntos luchan por salir adelante cada día. 
Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceite, papel higiénico, snacks, artículos de escolares y una vitrina. En lo futuro desea comprar u n frízer para vender productos lácteos, carne, pollo pues son productos que demandan sus clientes y necesita vender.
texts.en:
Julio, 49, was born in the city of Leon.  He is married, and is the father of 6 children. He's had a grocery store business for 9 years.

This grocery store belonged to his mother, but she passed it down to him, and ever since it has become his only business.  He supports his family with this business.  Four of his children are in school, and the other 2 live independently.  He shares his daily work with his wife.  He makes the purchases to stock the store, and his wife helps him tend to the business.  On the weekends, his children support him with the store so that his wife can rest.  This is how the family works together day by day to make progress.

Julio needs a loan to buy staple foods and other consumer goods such as cooking oil, toilet paper, snacks, school supplies, and a glass display case.  In the future, he wants to buy a freezer so that he could sell dairy products, meat, and chicken.  He needs to sell these products because his customers are demanding them.

loans.use: to buy staple foods and other consumer goods such as cooking oil, toilet paper, snacks, school supplies, and a glass display case

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jane. She is married and has two children aged 7 and 18. She has two additional dependents that live with her to help with their schooling. 

In 1998, Jane established her fish business because she wanted to help her husband provide for their home. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,382,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. 

Jane requires a loan in order to buy more fish for sale. In the future, she plans to open another outlet in the market. The competition is high, but Jane is able to cope because of her time in the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Tutu. She is married and has two children aged four and eight. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help a sister with her schooling. 

In 2006, Tutu established her textiles business to earn an income after dropping out of school. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,170,200 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  

Tutu requires a loan in order to buy cotton, lace, and other materials for sale. In the future, she plans to expand to trade in Brillion materials, and she hopes to see her business grow. 

The competition is average, but Tutu is able to cope because she sells on market days and has two sisters who help in the business by hawking around the city market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles.

loans.name: Binta Mena

texts.en:
Bintu is 39 years old, married, and has two children. In 1998, Bintu established her cosmetics business. She began her business to assist her husband. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are women.  Working seven days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL a month. 

Bintu is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which she will use to increase her cosmetics stock level. She hopes that this loan will increase her number of customers and her profits. In the future, Bintu plans to educate her children to university and finish their house, together with her husband, at Waterloo village.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Miriam de 33 años , esta casada con Glicerio de 38 años y juntos tiene 3 hijos pequeños con quienes reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe la cual fue adquirida hace poco.Desde niña fue siempre participe de las actividades concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico en su localidad y al lograr la mayoría de edad recibió en calidad de herencia unas parcelas en donde cultiva cacao orgánico .Lleva casi 13 años en esta actividad y comenta que es de su agrado puesto que al brindar el correcto mantenimiento a las plantaciones cacaoteras permite obtener buenos frutos y posteriormente ser vendidos a los centros de acopio la localidad mas cercana . En ocasiones para agilizar las diversas labores contrata trabajadores del lugar.
Al hallarse en medio de la campaña productiva desea contar con capital de trabajo esperando asi obtener buenos resultados.Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la construcción de su vivienda  base de material noble con el cual espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y proceder con la compra de abono orgánico los cuales son esenciales para el crecimiento adecuado de las mazorcas cacaoteras .
texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old and married to Glicerio, who is 38 years old. Together they have 3 small children, with whom they live in a home built of adobe (a natural building material) which they acquired recently. Since she was a child, she has always participated in activities surrounding organic cacao production in her town.

When she reached the age of majority, she received, as an inheritance, some plots of land where she grows organic cacao. She has been doing this work for almost 13 years. She says that it is pleasing because if she provides proper maintenance to the cacao plantations, she gets good results, and sells her produce to collection centres in the nearest town. At times she contracts workers to speed up the various jobs that need to get done.

Now that it's the middle of the growing season, she wants to have working capital, in hopes of achieving good results. Her long term goal is to build her house with good materials, which she hopes will improve the quality of life of her family. With this loan she needs 1,000 nuevos soles to proceed with the purchase of organic fertilizer, which is essential for the good growth of cocoa pods.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Josefa del socorro vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como docente de un CDI  donde su horas laborales empieza desde las 7am y termina a la 2 pm donde es  muy querida por los padres que dejan a su niños al cuido de ella.

Doña Josefa está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra calzado  ya que  la comercialización de estos le genera oros ingresos  que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa del Socorro lives in the city of Managua. She works as a teacher at a child care center between the hours of 7:00 A.M. and 2:00 P.M. Josefa is well-respected by the parents who leave their children in her care.

Doña Josefa is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of shoes that she can sell for additional income. This will help her deal with her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она уже 16 лет торгует на местном привокзальном рынке разными промтоварами. У нее есть свое торговое место, что помогает сэкономить на расходах на аренду. 
Елена обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию электротоваров и хозтоваров под реализацию. Дополнительный ассортимент продукции привлечет новый клиентский контингент и поможет Елене развивать свой бизнес и достроить дом, о чем она уже давно мечтает.
texts.en:
Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She has been trading various manufactured goods for 16 years in the local wholesale market. She has her own retail space, which helps to save on rental expenses. 

Yelena turned to Kiva for a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase a batch of electrical and household goods on consignment. Additional products attract new customers and will help Yelena to grow her business and to finish building her home, as she has long been dreaming.

loans.use: to buy a batch of electrical and household goods on consignment

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Hawa. She is married and has two children, aged eight and one. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they are shop assistants. 

In 2011, Hawa established her oil, bags of rice, soft drinks, soap, etc. business. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of the home, since her husband's salary is not enough. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are women. Working seven days per week and 16 hours per day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to increase her stocks, such as oil, rice, sugar, salt, drinks, and soap. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her stock level and profit margin. In the future, Hawa plans to become a distributor/supplier to the other market women. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for oil, rice, sugar, salt, drinks, soap, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.es: La Sra. Norah tiene 24 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   Panadera desde hace 4 años, su panadería se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Norah utilizara este préstamo para la compra de muebles ya que quiere ofrecer sus productos a su clientela, La Sra. Norah enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en lograr tener  una mejor calidad de vida, la Sra. Norah se siente feliz ya que esta es una buena oportunidad para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Norah is 24 years old and has been making and selling bread from her bakery for the past four years. Her business is located in the District of Pampahasi.

This loan is her first cycle with Emprender. Sra. Norah will use the proceeds to buy furnishings that will help her offer her products to her customers. She faces challenges in her business as she strives to gain more customers and generate more income. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to attain a better quality of life. Sra. Norah is pleased to have this fine opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy new furnishings for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 11 years. 

In 2000, Kadiatu established her bundle water business. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase bundles of water from the factory for resale by retailing. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level and she will be able to access more profits, hence her business will grow. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a water company and become a distributor of water by purchasing one brand new water machine for manufacture. 

Kadiatu is a twin and her partner is a police officer. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more bundles of pure water.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр – фермер из Виноградово, Новокаховский регион. Он уже 14 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 85 сотках земли Александр выращивает ранние и поздние кабачки, перец, баклажаны, а также на дополнительных 64 сотках выращивает в открытом грунте 30 000 кустов перца. 
Александр планирует использовать средства, полученные от КИВА, в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена на посев, приобрести пленку, удобрения и дрова, а также сделать ремонт теплицы и установить систему капельного орошения. Использовав средства на содержание и расширение тепличного хозяйства, Александр сможет получить хороший урожай и использовать полученную прибыль на нужды семьи и последующее развитии своего дела.
texts.en:
Aleksandr is a farmer from Vinogradovo, Novokakhovskii Region. For 14 years, he has been engaged in greenhouse farming. On 85 acres of land, Aleksandr grows early and late squash, peppers, eggplants, as well as an additional 64 acres grows in the open field 30,000 peppers bushes. 

Aleksandr plans to use the funds received from Kiva, in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seeds for planting, to purchase greenhouse film, fertilizer, and wood, and to make repairs on the greenhouses and to install a drip irrigation system. 

Using funds for the maintenance and expansion of greenhouses, Aleksandr is able to get a good harvest, and to use the profits for the family's needs and future development of his business.

loans.use: закупить семена на посев, приобрести пленку, удобрения и дрова, а также сделать ремонт теплицы и установить систему капельного орошения

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей мудро использовал предыдущий кредит от КИВА, увеличив количество товара, добавив ноутбуки. Параллельно Андрей занялся строительством дома, на что тоже уходит немало средств. 
Андрею понадобилась сумма в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить оборотные средства за счет закупки бытовой техники. Хороший ассортимент всегда привлекает покупателей, а соответственно увеличиваются и продажи, а, значит, и доход.
texts.en:
Andrei used the previous loan from Kiva wisely, increasing the number of goods and adding laptops. In paralle, Andrei engaged in building a house, to which a lot of money also goes. 

Andrei needed a sum of 20,000 Hryvnia to replenish his working capital through the purchase of household appliances. A good assortment always attracts buyers, and increases in turn sales, and hence, profit.

loans.use: to replenish his working capital by buying household appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for different types of hair.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama, a married mother of a three-year-old. In 2005, Mariama established her retail business to assist her husband in the running of the home. Located in the outskirts of the city, her enterprise is open 7 days a week and 15 hours a day. Her customers are mainly women.

Mariama is requesting a loan of Le 3000000 to purchase used bags by the bale for resale. She hopes that the profits arising from this loan will enable her to build a house with her husband and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more bales of used bags.

loans.name: Mirna Haydee

texts.es:
Mirna, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y cultivo de plátano, Ella tiene 46 años de edad y su esposo 50 años, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian secundaria, pero uno de ellos que su edad es de 18 años le ayuda en las labores.
Ella realiza los cultivos  con su esposo y su hijo, tiene toda su vida de dedicarse a la agricultura, ya que siempre le ha gustado. El crédito le  ayudara mucho para la compra de abono, semilla, preparacion de la tierra.
Al llevar acabo dicha inversión, le será de mucha utilidad, porque fortalecerá más sus cultivos, obtener más ingresos e incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
Mirna grows basic grains and cultivates bananas. She is 46 years old and her husband is 50. They have four children who are in secondary school, but one of them is 18 and helps with the work.

Mirna looks after her crops with her husband and her son. She has been farming her whole life and has always enjoyed the work. This loan will be a great help with buying compost and seeds so that she can prepare her land. Upon carrying out this investment, she will find it to be very useful. She can further strengthen her crops, increase production, and obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds for preparing her land.

loans.name: El Renacer 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Mireya is the coordinator of her group El Renacer (Reborn) 1, 2 & 3, located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, where the economy is dominated by agriculture. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Mireya is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza, after having repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which sells fruits, vegetables, meat and charcoal. She will use her loan to increase her inventory. She will use the profits to save to build her own house.

Mireya says that her most difficult challenge is to have Dominican permission to live in and to have her own house. Like other Haitian citizens, she is working to get her Dominican residence. This group is composed mostly of Haitian citizens from this batey close to Hato Mayor. Mireya started her enterprise after joining this group almost three years ago when she got her first loan. In the future, she dreams of having her own house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits and meat.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. Les presento al grupo “El Esfuerzo es Grande” ALCOM  B0099 conformados por 09 socios trabajadoras y pasan al ciclo 07. Noymi es una de las de las integrantes de grupo ella tiene 47 con dos hijos ella cuenta con una bodega desde hace 2 años el préstamo que le dio EDAPROSPO – KIVA lo uso en la compra de abarrotes y útiles escolares su mayor deseo es tener una bodega mas  grande. Esta agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Noymi es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo negro y buzo negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. Meet the group "El Esfuerzo es Grande", made up of nine hard working members who have reached their seventh loan cycle. 

Noymi is one of the group members and is 47 years old. She has two children and has run a store for two years. The loan that EDAPROSPO gave her was used to buy groceries and school supplies. Her most sought after dream is to have a larger store. She is thankful for the Kiva lenders for allowing her to continue growing her business. Noymi is the third from the left wearing a black tee shirt and black sweatpants.

loans.use: to buy products of basic need.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, a resident of Malindi, Kenya, is a married mother of two school-going children. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for six years and employs one person. She is also employed as a teacher.

Halima was introduced to Milango by her friends, and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes to sell such as dresses, trousers, shirts, sheets, etc.

Halima believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children as she works toward her goal of owning a wholesale shop despite the high cost of stocks from the suppliers which makes most of her items beyond the reach of the public.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell such as dresses, trousers, shirts, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is from Sisian town. He is 29 years old and lives with his parents who are retired with pensions. Armen owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates potatoes. He sells the gathered harvest in the market and gets income, which is hardly enough for covering his family's basic costs. Together with agriculture, Armen also studies at the Armenian State Agrarian University in Sisian town. He studies in the agribusiness department and is on his fifth course. As Armen is the only breadwinner in the family it is very difficult for him to sustain his parents’ living and at the same time to save money for education. So he has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for Armen to complete his education. He dreams of having a big farm and ensuring a better future for his beloved parents.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more material

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She has two children who attend school. She is in the transport industry, and she owns a motorcycle.

Diana learned about Milango through a friend, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is high insecurity: the motorcycles at times get stolen.

Diana is applying for a loan of 31,500 KES to repair her motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to educate children and for personal use. Her ambition is to increase the number of vehicles in her fleet.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is grateful for the first loan she received through Kiva. Her business improved, and it is due to that improvement that she is applying for another loan. She is also grateful because her secondary business in the transport industry is also doing well.

Wayua is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to purchase items like bed sheets, shoes, and second-hand clothing for sale. She believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. Wayua is focused on one day owning a wholesale shop, despite the challenge of low business seasons.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing and linens.

loans.name: Restauracion 1 Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of her group Restauracion (Restoration) 1. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. 

Yesenia is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She runs a beauty salon. Yesenia started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of cosmetics, hair and beauty products, and other instruments. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to establish a sustainable business. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is the mother of three children. She had been living in deteriorated housing and decided to start building a house. She took out loans with Esperanza almost five years ago to expand her business selling clothes. She used most of her profits to save, planning to build her house. Now she is requesting a loan for materials to build her house.

Juana is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost five years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received nine loans to invest in her business. Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their houses while running their businesses and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks, and other building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for farm cultivation, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nayci

texts.es:
Nayci de 21 años, esta casada con Jhon y juntos tienen una hija de 4 años de edad respectivamente .Actualmente vive en una casa de material noble , la cual le fue cedida de sus padres. Desde muy niña fue instruida por parte de sus padres en las diversas tareas agrícolas referentes a la producción de cacao orgánico,y es por esta razón que al cumplir la mayoria de edad recibio en calidad de herencia una parcela para asi poder desempeñarse como agricultora y obtener un sustento para su familia . Lleva 4 años de trabajo en el campo y hasta entonces ha logrado desempeñarse como una buena productora de cacao orgánico contando ocasionalmente con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar.
En esta oportunidad al encontrarse en medio de la campaña productiva desea contar con capital para proceder con el segundo deshierbo de campaña puesto que es muy indispensable para obtener una producción de calidad a fin de obtener buenos precios por parte de los acopiadores de lugar.
Sus objetivo a largo plazo es acabar con la construcción del segundo piso de su hogar para posteriormente  aperturar una tienda de abarrotes.En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para pagar a los trabajadores y proceder con el segundo deshierbo de campaña para optimizar su producción final.
texts.en:
Nayci is 21 years old and is married to Jhon with whom she has a 4 year old daughter. She currently lives in a home made of solid materials, which she inherited from her parents. Since she was very young she was taught by her parents of the various agricultural tasks involved in producing organic cacao. For this reason when she became of age she received a parcel of land to make a living as a farmer and receive earnings for her family. She has been working in the fields for four years and has been able to continue as a good producer of organic cacao and at time receives the help of workers from the area. 

With this opportunity she finds herself in the middle of the preparation process. She hopes to have the capital to continue with the second weeding process that is essential to have a quality harvest in order to get good prices from the buyers. 

Her long term goal is to finish building the second floor of her home and later on, open up a grocery store. For this opportunity, she needs 1,500 nuevos soles to pay the day laborers and proceed with the second weeding process to optimize her final production.

loans.use: to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Washe

texts.en:
Washe is grateful to have received a first loan from Kiva. He lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. His retail business is moving on well and has a bright future, though he currently faces lack of funds to buy additional stock arising from increased demand. He sells items like rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. 

Washe is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to buy more stock for his store. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family, especially by providing an education for his children. Washe has also been engaging in farming to supplement the family income.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера – вдова, детей воспитывает сама. Ей часто бывает трудно финансово. Но своевременно оказанная ей помощь, помогает ей не только продержаться на плаву, но и поднимать своих детей на ноги.
Вера обратилась к КИВА за суммой в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить необходимый товар, а именно нитки, пряжу, бисер и вышивку. Товар у Веры популярный, у нее всегда много покупателей. Она надеется снова полностью реализовать приобретенный товар и улучшить условия проживания своей семьи за счет полученной прибыли.
texts.en: Vera is a widow raising her children by herself.  She struggles with financial security.  Financial support will not only help her stay afloat, but will help her children get on their feet.  She has turned to Kiva for a loan of 5000 griven in order to buy necessary inventory, namely thread, yarn, beads and embroidery.  Vera's goods are very popular and she has many clients.  She hopes to use the income provided by this new inventory to improve her life and the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy necessary inventory like thread, yarn, beads and embroidery.

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Priscar lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single business lady and runs a tailoring shop which she has been operating for three years. In this business, she makes new clothes and also does repairs.

Priscar learned about Milango through her relatives, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is seasonal demand.
 
Priscar is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy materials and other sewing devices. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business. Her dream is to be the leading tailor in the area by acquiring more orders for school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy materials and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Las Mariposas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Alejandra is one of the members of Las Mariposas (The Butterflies) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. These ten women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Alejandra makes her home in a simple structure with her two children. She is a single mother and her children are attending school. Alejandra is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a beauty salon, and this loan is intended for purchasing miscellaneous hair and beauty supplies. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to provide her children what they need. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community. She has been in this business for over 15 years and earns 12,000 PHP every month. 

Erlinda joined GDMPC in 2005, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over six years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2006, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business raising poultry. She also sells fish and coconuts. The business has been running for one year. Bahati has one child, who is attending school. 

Bahati learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is debt.
 
Bahati is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy chicken feed and a new batch of chicks. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to fund her ambition of keeping laying hens.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a 21-year-old small business owner looking to help his family. Juan migrated to this country at the age of seven with his mother, a single mom, from Columbia in search of the American Dream. He acquired Truly Clean, a pool cleaning service, in January 2013. Juan is a hardworking individual who wants to expand his services and provide clean pools for the community he serves. 

Juan is in need of a $10,000 loan for his business. A loan of this amount will help him to purchase new equipment, fix the company vehicle, and to market his business. This loan will not only help Juan to grow his business, but also to help support his family.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment, fix the company vehicle, and to market his business,  which will help grow his business and support his family.

loans.name: Alma Bonita

texts.en:
Alma Bonita is 35 years old and married with two children, of whom one is in school. Alma Bonita works very hard to provide for them.

For three years, Alma Bonita has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, and canned goods to sell in her general store.

In the future, Alma Bonita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, and canned goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is 31 years old and from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child. Jeanny owns and operates a corn plantation and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Jeanny joined GDMPC to be able to use their financial services. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm chemicals. She expects to reap a good harvest and will invest her revenue in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 59 years old and married. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana plantation in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for over 15 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

Crisanta joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Alexandra Maria

texts.es: Alexandra, es una joven de 31 años de edad soltera vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, su labor es de gestor de cartera y cobro desde hace cinco años, este primer crédito que solicita es para terminar de construir cuartos que ya había empezado pero por falta de dinero no lo había podido concluir, por este motivo solicita financiamiento para darle fino a las paredes, poner ventanas y piso, necesitara comprar cemento, arena, verjas y ventanas, para ir mejorando su hogar poco a poco.
texts.en: Alexandra, a young woman aged 31, is single and lives with her parents. She does not have children. She has worked as a portfolio and credit manager for five years. She is applying for this first loan to finish building rooms that she had begun to build, but could not finish due to lack of money. For this reason she is applying for funding to finish off the walls, and put in windows and flooring. She will need to buy cement, sand, railings and windows, to improve her home little by little.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, railings and windows.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Edna is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 55 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a tailoring shop in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over eight years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

Conception joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for tailoring. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Emma has been in this business for 16 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her motorcycle transport business.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts for  better service

loans.name: Nelgen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelgen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Nelgen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines, rice, sugar and other groceries needed for her business.

Nelgen  has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines, rice, sugar and other groceries needed for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rose works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetics. Rose is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines and other groceries needed for her business.

Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines and other  groceries needed for her business

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 41 years old and comes from a small village of Akhaltsikhe district. He is married and lives with his wife Iamze, their 18-year-old son and their 13-year-old daughter. Iamze works as a teacher at a local school and gets a monthly income. 

Akaki is involved in agricultural business. In particular, he has a milk cow. Iamze milks their cow and produces cheese products, which are sold at local markets at a good price. Besides, Akaki has 0.9 hectares of agricultural land. He cultivates the land and sows beetroot and potato seeds. Akaki works hard to insure a good harvest. He sells the harvested products locally. 

Akaki requested a loan for purchasing potato seeds for sowing. The harvested potatoes will be sold and the profit earned will be reinvested in the same business. Akaki awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Rabeeha

texts.en: Rabeeha is a 30-year-old married lady. She is a mother of two sons. Rabeeha has a few sheep and goats that she takes care of for sale and she uses their milk for dairy products. She is applying for this youth loan to increase the number of goats she has.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats she has.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 46 years old and married with three children who are in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

For 12 years, Liza has run a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like oil, sugar, and noodles to sell in her general store.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like oil, sugar, and noodles to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 38-year-old widow. She has been selling blankets for the last year to support herself. Now Hiyam is applying for a loan to buy more blankets and some bed covers for resale  to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and some bed covers for resale

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 18-year-old son in a small village of the Bolnisi district.  Vugar is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, he has 10 sheep. Besides that, he has a plot of agricultural land where potatoes are grown. 

Vugar works hard to insure a good harvest. He sells the harvested products locally at a good price. He requested a loan for purchasing a sheep. After purchasing an additional sheep, he will be able to expand his livestock. 

Vugar plans to sell lambs locally at a good price. This will increase the income of the family and with increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  items to sell (canned goods, snacks, beverages, and more).

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en:
Anhtuya is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons in a house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Olziitegsh, age 40, runs a transportation service. Her sons Gurbazar, age 18, and Sugar, age 8, go to local schools. 

Anhtuya has been working in various fields and now she is starting her own business running a spare parts sales business in a rental place. She is a hardworking, modest, and optimistic woman. She has experience in retail and her husband knows a lot about vehicles and spare parts. She is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and run her new spare parts retail business successfully.
